column1: Improve NuGet index logging.
column39:
Currently when Artifactory index NuGet repository we print logs in case there is an issue with specific package.

A n example for additional needed loggers is in case there is a conflict in packages which have been requested using virtual repository, then, in some case we will no have relevant logs and it will be harder to debug the issue.
column252:
05/Sep/18 1:01 PM;nasir_amin@waters.com;In our particular case we have a virtual repository which has a local repository and a smart remote repository pointing to another internal artifactory instance.

In this case, it seems that we have the same package present in the local repository of both artifactory instance (which should not be an issue anyway but it seems to be the cause of issues)

This was the error we were getting if we pasted the nuget cli command in the browser

This was the command

[http://artifactory|http://artifactory/]-server/artifactory/api/nuget/unifi-nuget-virtual/FindPackagesById()?id=%27Package.Id%27
{  "errors" : [ {    "status" : 400,    "message" : "Comparison method violates its general contract!"  } ]
}
We worked with Yehuda to narrow it down to a particular version of some packages. This package was duplicated and removing them from one instance of artifactory's local nuget repository resolved the above error. However, it is still not clear what was wrong with the duplicate packages as Artifactory should be handling that gracefully.

The logs don't say anything about the above error at all. An ideal resolution in terms of logs will be if the logs can print the packages that are causing the issue and its source.

column1: Add the ability to keep download statistics when moving files.
column39: Since currently when moving artifact to different location the downloads statistics are getting deleted, please add the ability to save it.

column1: build promote rest API should show better success message
column39:
Currently, the build promote rest api ([https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Artifactory+REST+API#ArtifactoryRESTAPI-BuildPromotion]) returns the following upon a successful promotion:

curl -u admin:password -XPOST http://localhost:8081/artifactory/api/build/promote/test/42 -H "Content-Type: application/json" -T ./prom.json 

{

  "messages" : [ ]

}

There should be a better message like:

Build <BUILD NAME>/<BUILD NUMBER> has been successfully promoted to <Repository>.

column1: list build promotion status next to build number or in build information
column39: There should be the build promotion status listed next to the build name or in the build information (see attached image).

column1: Add ability to compare build numbers of different builds
column39:
.Currently, there is a build diff functionality ([https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Artifactory+REST+API#ArtifactoryRESTAPI-BuildsDiff)] built into Artifactory however this feature only works for different build numbers of the same build.

If you have a multi branch Jenkins pipeline job, each branch in the job is deployed as a separate build in Artifactory. For example:

JobName1:BranchName1 : Build # 1

JobName1:BranchName2 : Build # 1

 

There should be a way to compare build numbers of different branches of a multi branch job in Artifactory:

Ie. compare JobName1:BranchName1 : Build # 1 with JobName1:BranchName2 : Build # 1

column1: build retention should be part of the build.info json when doing a pipeline job
column39:
The Artifactory Jenkins plugin when configuring a retention policy in a pipeline script for example, will not publish the retention policy details of the build with the build.json file.

The only indication of build retention is a simple Entry in the build log and the requests logs in Artifactory, e.g:
Sending async request for build retention, deleting build artifacts, max number of builds to store: 1.
It will be more useful if this will be part of the build.info, to get information if this build has a retention policy or not.

column1: The ability to skip the creation of S3 bucket should be configurable in binarystore.xml
column39:
Starting version 6.0, we have added the ability to skip the creation of an S3 bucket on Artifactory startup.
Currently it is configurable via *artifactory.system.properties* by setting artifactory.s3.autoBucketCreation.skip=true (deafult false).

This improvement is to have this configurable in the *binarystore.xml* instead, and to have it *documented* as part of the [S3 parameters|https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Configuring+the+Filestore#ConfiguringtheFilestore-S3BinaryProvider].

column1: improve remote repo artifact caching time
column39:
Downloading files from a remote repo takes much longer than when you download directly from the source:

time wget [https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/org/seleniumhq/selenium/server/selenium-server/1.0.2/selenium-server-1.0.2-standalone.jar]

2018-08-24 13:13:30 (4.30 MB/s) - ‘selenium-server-1.0.2-standalone.jar’ saved [16176795/16176795] 

*real 0m4.572s*

user 0m0.066s

sys 0m0.168s

In Artifactory:

20180824131041|*14237*|REQUEST|0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1|admin|GET|/maven-central/org/seleniumhq/selenium/server/selenium-server/1.0.2/selenium-server-1.0.2-standalone.jar|HTTP/1.1|200|0

The Artifactory request takes over 3 x longer. You can see in the attached trace files that the download bottleneck is when it tries saving the resource to the cache:

2018-08-24T13:10:28.736-07:00 Downloading content
2018-08-24T*13:10:28*.736-07:00 Saving resource to maven-central-cache
2018-08-24T*13:10:41*.702-07:00 Un-expiring cached resource if needed

The issue seems to stem from the SQL queries ran in the background, as there are a certain amount of "select * from " queries along with a dynamic amount of "insert into" statements depending on how long the artifact path is. This proves to be more of an impact the larger the artifact path is.

Also, there are duplicate "select *" queries. In the attached jdbc logger, search for:
 * 'SELECT * FROM nodes WHERE repo = 'maven-central-cache' AND node_path = 'org/seleniumhq/selenium/server/selenium-server/1.0.2')
 * 'SELECT node_type FROM nodes WHERE repo = 'maven-central-cache' AND node_path = 'org/seleniumhq' AND node_name = 'selenium''

 

The time it takes to cache artifacts should be improved

column1: Sharding cluster for cache in HA mode
column39: When Artifactory is running in HA mode and using S3 as the storage backend, it would be great if nodes could fetch items from each other's caches. For large files (multiple GB), the difference in performance between serving from S3 and from cache can be very large.

column1: cran local repositories metadata structure is not the same as the cran remote registry
column39:
cran local repositories metadata structure is not the same as the cran remote registry.

Artifactory version-- 6.1.0

Due to this some cran dependency management tools like "packrat" are unable to install packages when they are pointing to the cran local repo in Artifactory. The cran metadata in cran local repo should be similar to the cran remote.

https://rstudio.github.io/packrat/

The same dependency management tool "packrat" is able to install cran packages if it is pointing to a remote cran repo in Artifactory.

For example here is the cran remote endpoint where the packages exist [https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/]

If you go to the following endpoint you will find some additional metadata files in the cran remote which don't exist in a cran local repo [https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Meta/]

There is also this Archive folder in cran remote that contains older versions of the packages [https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/]

The R command line tool looks for some metadata files when trying to install a package from a local cran repo that don't exist. Please see the comparison of request.log entries when requesting a package installation from a local cran repo and a remote cran repo:

Request entries for cran local showing requests for PACKAGES.rds and PACKAGES.gz files that don't exist in our cran local repo:

20180822201818|11|REQUEST|64.71.2.36|support-usw|GET|/cran-local/src/contrib/*PACKAGES.rds|HTTP/1.1|404|0*

20180822201818|3|REQUEST|64.71.2.36|support-usw|GET|/cran-local/src/contrib/*PACKAGES.gz|HTTP/1.1|404|0*

20180822201818|5|REQUEST|64.71.2.36|support-usw|GET|/cran-local/src/contrib/PACKAGES|HTTP/1.1|200|102

20180822201819|6|REQUEST|64.71.2.36|support-usw|GET|/cran-local/src/contrib/abundant_1.1.tar.gz|HTTP/1.1|200|7595

 

Request entries to a remote cran repo where it can find these files:

20180822203909|2608|REQUEST|64.71.2.36|support-usw|GET|/cran-remote/src/contrib/*PACKAGES.rds|HTTP/1.1|200|312788*

20180822203912|2350|REQUEST|64.71.2.36|support-usw|GET|/cran-remote/src/contrib/QUIC_1.1.tar.gz|HTTP/1.1|200|3593474

20180822203913|42|REQUEST|64.71.2.36|support-usw|GET|/ui/systemlogs/logData|HTTP/1.1|200|0

20180822203913|416|REQUEST|64.71.2.36|support-usw|GET|/cran-remote/src/contrib/abundant_1.1.tar.gz|HTTP/1.1|200|7595
column253:
10/Sep/18 9:11 PM;rjturek;We have 3 open customer tickets related to this internal JFrog ticket.

88366 Packrat is unable to restore packages from the local CRAN repos
88194 META folder for local CRAN repos
88193 ARCHIVE folder layout for CRAN local repos

I believe these simple steps will allow you to test publishing multiple versions of a well-formed R package (Without you needing to create an R package). This should help validate the issues discussed in this ticket.


First, GET 2 versions of the "random" package from the cran.r-project.org mirror 
 https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/random/

curl https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/random/random_0.1.0.tar.gz -o /tmp/random_0.1.0.tar.gz

curl https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/random/random_0.1.2.tar.gz -o /tmp/random_0.1.2.tar.gz


Then, PUT the first package file to your local CRAN-type repo:

curl -uadmin:password -X PUT "http://localhost/artifactory/cran-local/src/contrib/random_0.1.0.tar.gz" -T /tmp/random_0.1.0.tar.gz

>>> Expect to see cran-local:src/contrib/PACKAGES.gz file and cran-local:src/contrib/META folder and files within

Now to validate Archive folder location, PUT the second version of the package file:

curl -uadmin:password -X PUT "http://localhost/artifactory/cran-local/src/contrib/random_0.1.2.tar.gz" -T /tmp/random_0.1.2.tar.gz

>>> Expect to see cran-local:src/contrib/Archive/random/random_0.1.0.tar.gz
column254:
20/Nov/19 6:19 PM;mattermack;For those in the community, there are some open pull requests in [Packrat|https://github.com/rstudio/packrat/issues/583] and [Remotes|https://github.com/r-lib/remotes/issues/440].   

In older versions of R, the utils::install.packages functionality requires a PACKAGE.rds file to exist.  This does not exist in Artifactory.   To account for you, you may need to leverage a [miniCRAN|https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/miniCRAN/index.html] based solution.


{code:java}
withCallingHandlers(
    {    
        # create empty miniCRAN
        install.packages("miniCRAN", repos="https://YOUR_ARTIFACTORY/artifactory/your-cran/", verbose = TRUE)
        library("miniCRAN")
        dir.create(miniCranPath <- file.path("/tmp/project/", "miniCRAN"))
        pkgList <- c()
        makeRepo(pkgList, path = miniCranPath, repos="https://YOUR_ARTIFACTORY/artifactory/your-cran/", type = c("source"))
         
         
        dir.create(localPackagePath <- file.path("/tmp/project/", "localPath"))
         
        # download remotes
        download.file(url="https://YOUR_ARTIFACTORY/artifactory/your-cran/src/contrib/remotes_your_compiled_version.tar.gz", destfile=file.path(localPackagePath,"remotes_your_compiled_version.tar.gz"))
        addLocalPackage(pkgs = "remotes", pkgPath = localPackagePath, path=miniCranPath, type="source")
        install.packages("remotes", repos = paste0("file:///", miniCranPath), type = "source")
        library("remotes")
        print(packageVersion("remotes"))
         
         
        # download and install packrat
        download.file(url="https://YOUR_ARTIFACTORY/artifactory/your-cran/src/contrib/packrat_your_compiled_version.tar.gz", destfile=file.path(localPackagePath,"packrat_your_compiled_version.tar.gz"))
        addLocalPackage(pkgs = "packrat", pkgPath = localPackagePath, path=miniCranPath, type="source")
        install.packages("packrat", repos = paste0("file:///", miniCranPath), type = "source")
         
        library("packrat")
        print(packageVersion("packrat"))
    },
    warning=function(w) stop(w),
    error=function(w) stop(w)
){code}

column1: Add sync deletes artifacts for smart remote repository
column39:
Add the ability to sync deleted artifacts to the target repository. 

In our use case we configured a smart remote repository with the following steps :
 # Upload a file that contains the character 'a' to the source repo. 
 # Download this file on the target repo 
 # Change this file (upload the same file with a different character to the source repo) 
 # Try to download it again on the target repository 

As a workaround, you can remove the file from the cache target and download the file again remove the store artifacts locally option.

column1: Fix Sonar Issues
License Errors for Xray Should Give Clear Reason
column39:
Currently if Xray is connected to an Artifactory instance of invalid license the message _"Xray was able to reach Artifactory, but Artifactory was unable to reach Xray."_ will pop up, but there is no indication that it's due to a license error. 

It would save debugging time if the error indicated that the issue was due to the license.

column1: Allow for injecting block of config in SetMeUp-generated settings.xml
column39:
It would be ideal if it was possible to define a block of company-required configuration that is injected into the generated Maven settings.xml via Set Me Up. For example:
{code:java}
<proxies>
<proxy>
<id>http</id>
<active>true</active>
<protocol>http</protocol>
<username></username>
<password></password>
<host>proxyhost.our.org</host>
<port>80</port>
<nonProxyHosts>localhost|*.our.org</nonProxyHosts>
</proxy>
<proxy>
<id>https</id>
<active>true</active>
<protocol>https</protocol>
<username></username>
<password></password>
<host>proxyhost.our.org</host>
<port>80</port>
<nonProxyHosts>localhost|*.our.org</nonProxyHosts>
</proxy>
</proxies>
{code}

column1: Request for additive user 'defaults' file
column39:
Java heap size is likely the most common example here, so I'll use it for this example but I'm certain that there are others.

Currently, to automate changes to the default 'default' file, AFAICT, I must match the -Xmx2g string in the 'defaults' file and modify it for the value I like.

There's no assurances that the actual defaults file, which is shell script, will maintain the current form in future releases.

This is a request to formalize both the method and format of user defaults for the JVM running artifactory. A _possible option_ would be to allow the user to create a properties file that contains user properties:
----
{noformat}
jvm_minimum_heap=256M
jvm_maximum_heap=4G{noformat}
It seems that artifactory.system.properties hints at this but more wants to be about artifactory rather than the JVM and contains stuff that most users are not interested in.

This would make user modification of the JVM easier to automate.

column1: remove PostgreSQL database driver from artifactory docker image
column39:
Please remove outdated PostgreSQL database driver from artifactory's docker image.

As a user, I would like to have the choice what version of a jdbc driver I want to use, in the same fashion as you do it with mysql.

The provided solution ([https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Changing+the+Database#ChangingtheDatabase-PassingEnvironmentVariables)] would provide enough flexibility and makes it consistent with for other supported databases.

 motivation: I would like to use a newer driver version for Postgres, but I have to remove the outdated driver first in order to avoid shadowing.

column1: LDAP users added in Artifactory should be able to update their user profile (add SSH keys)
column39:
Currently when you login via LDAP to Artifactory, the user is added to a Group which has Admin privileges or a Group without Admin privileges. However in both the cases, the user is not able to get an option to add SSH keys to his profile page. The user is able to unlock the profile and generate API key and encrypted password, but cannot update their SSH keys.

For this test we have made sure that "Allow Created Users Access To Profile Page" is always enabled in the LDAP settings page.

*Once this happens it is also not possible to Edit the user and manually enable the "Can Update Profile" option.* 

The expected behavior is that the LDAP User should be able to update their user profile page and if needed add the SSH keys to their User.

 

Current Workaround which involves manual steps:
 # Remove user from the LDAP admin group.
 # Login to Artifactory which will update the User groups.
 # Now you will be able to Check "Can Update Profile" checkbox in the Edit user page.
https://<host>/artifactory/webapp/#/admin/security/users/<username>/edit
 # The user can now enter an SSH key in their profile:
https://<host>/artifactory/webapp/#/profile
 # Add the user back to the LDAP admin group.
column252:
22/Feb/19 4:57 PM;czardis;I would argue this is a bug, and a frustrating one at that...

Please could it be addressed, so our users can add their own SSH keys via the UI?
column253: 22/Feb/19 5:00 PM;czardis;Please note this is not limited to LDAP - we just tested adding a new user via SAML and it has the same problem

column1: Display Binary Size per Repo
column39:
Although there is technically no such thing as a repo-level binary size (size of actual space being used by the repo) because of checksum based storage, it would be useful to have a way of knowing the total deduplicated size of a repository for quota and auditing reasons.

This information can be easily found with AQL as a workaround.

column1: Replicator HA Custom Header Challenge
column39:
According to our document: [https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Replicator#Replicator-HighAvailability] when using the Replicator for High Availability, a special header is used (HTTP header:  {{X-JFRPL-TXID) but it may be difficult to have this special header made on certain load balancers and reverse proxy server that does not support it.  For example, AWS load balancer doesn't provide an option for custom headers. }}

Is there another way of being able to use Replicator in an HA environment without this custom header?

column1: Extend Revoke API Key - Allow Filtering By Date / User
column39:
Recently the npm world was rocked by [https://github.com/eslint/eslint-scope/issues/39] , where an infected npm package threatened to harvest huge swathes of developer credentials. Once they had removed the affected packages and ensured the site credentials were being sent to was shut down, they decided to revoke all npm tokens created before the "all clear". This meant that any users who had proactively recycled their tokens in response to the situation wouldn't have to go through the pain of having them revoked again.

When we decided to follow npm's example, we only had the choice to revoke *all* API keys, not just those created before a certain time. This is because the Artifactory Rest API for revoking all API keys ([https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Artifactory+REST+API#ArtifactoryRESTAPI-RevokeAllAPIKeys)] has no 'createdBefore' field. In fact, the underlying database does not even store when the key was created. This meant that users who were already proactive in protecting their credentials had to have their access revoked unnecessarily.

Here's an example entry from "access_users_custom_data" (user_id, prop_key, prop_value) :
|1007|apiKey|JE8L2A...|


In order to be able to delete all keys older than a certain point via the API, the database would need to be extended to have a 'time_created' property for API keys (if other entries in access_users_custom_data don't need this access_users_credentials could be separated out until a unique table), and the API would need extending to allow parameters to be given 

For this functionality to be useful to us we would also need to be able to exclude certain known-good users from the revocation (e.g. createdBefore x, excludeUsers list,y )

Until this is implemented we've had to manually get a list of users together and run the single-user API key delete call in a loop, which is hardly ideal, and completely misses the ability to filter by date created.
column252:
01/Mar/19 3:47 PM;czardis;In lieu of a full implementation of this issue, it would be desirable to have a queryable field in the database showing the API key's creation date - that way we can conduct our own searches.

Adding this data to the database is of course an essential pre-requisite of this issue.

It looks like this is related with: RTFACT-14971 and RTFACT-14478

Or at least having a checkbox to toggle the case sensitivity with this user preference stored.

column39: Enrich the backup UI with a full backup history (backup timestamp, status, size, etc).

column1: Add an ability to query Xray/Artifactory for the artifacts that have not been yet scanned
column39:
Until the new Artifactory <> Xray integration, it was possible using AQL and the Xray annotated properties. Now this is changed. 

This is useful for:

(1) Debugging issues
(2) Having the customer option to know what artifacts exactly have been already processed

column1: Build dependency scopes table should support more than 4000 characters as CLOB
column39:
Currently, the Build dependency scopes is a VARCHAR2 data type and as such is limited to 4000 characters.  This can cause certain large builds (android builds spanning multiple OSs) to fail if the dependency scopes exceed 4000 characters.

A workaround is to change the table to a CLOB datatype, which can store significantly longer strings and allows the build to complete.  However, implementing this workaround generates:

_ORA-00932: inconsistent datatypes: expected - got CLOB_

This is caused by this statement:

_SELECT distinct build_dependencies.dependency_name_id as id,build_dependencies.dependency_type as type,build_dependencies.dependency_scopes as scope,build_dependencies.sha1 FROM build_dependencies_
_left join build_modules on build_modules.module_id=build_dependencies.module_id_
_left join builds on  build_modules.build_id = builds.build_id_
_where builds.build_number = '426' and builds.build_date = 1530223214417 and build_modules.module_name_id = 'com.contoso.retailapp:app:6.7.0.426'_

Specfically the *distinct* is incompatible with CLOB and causes this error.  Removing it from the statement fixes this issue.

The improvement request is:
 # Support build dependency scopes exceeding 4k characters (likely as CLOB)
 # Support CLOB datatypes

column1: Prevent Artifactory from starting up when using a case-insensitive database
column39:
Prevent Artifactory from starting up when using a case-insensitive database or show a warning to admin users.

 

Using a case-insensitive database can lead to issues with non-obvious causes and can be very hard to recover from. Artifactory should not allow users to get into this state.

column1: Support patterns when specifying user plugin permissions
Bower Set Me Up to include shorthand-resolver
column39:
From version 4.11.0, Artifactory supports Bower [shorthand-resolver|https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Bower+Repositories#BowerRepositories-UsingtheBowerShorthandResolver] resolution.

 

While in the wiki we mentioned how it should be added to the .bowerrc, it has no reference in the "Set Me Up".

*This is a request to add this to the "Set Me Up".*

column1: The "Set me up" page should allow to generate appropriate settings for the selected authentication method.
column39:
Currently, Artifactory can be authenticated using several methods:

1. Domain password

2. An encrypted password

3.Api key

4.AccessToken

 

This is not reflected in the settings of the "Set Me Up" page
The "Set me up" page should allow you to generate appropriate settings for the selected authentication method.

column1: System Logs page incorrectly shows updated and modified timestamps in IDT timezone
column39: The Admin -> System Logs web page shows "file last modified" and "view last updated" timestamps with an IDT timezone. The timestamps are actually in the timezone of the system, not IDT. These timestamps should be shown with the correct timezone label.

column1: Allow using S3 with Storage Sharding
column39: This is to request a feature in Artifactory's binarystore setting to allow using both NFS and S3 shards. It is difficult to move very large NFS storage to S3; thus needing hybrid solution when needing to use S3 as a shard

column1: 'successful' sometimes misspelled in log entries
column39:
I occasionally encounter log entries, like this one, where 'successful' is misspelled as 'successfull'

??2018-06-19 09:34:21,754 [art-exec-1162670] [INFO ] (o.a.a.h.p.HaPropagationServiceImpl:555) - Propogation of artifactory.cluster.license was succesfull??

column1: Protection for service_id
column39:
Since version 5.7 we moved to store the service_id in the Artifactory DB.

However, it is possible to change the serive_id by placing the file in the correct path in the filesystem.

$ARTIFACTORY_HOME/etc/security/access/keys/service_id

When the file is there, once you restart it will be loaded into Artifactory.

 

This mechanism is too risky and must be more protected. Perhaps we can change the expected filename to import to have a ".import" or something similar to the way we force replace the Access keys.

column1: Create Access Tokens via the UI
column39:
Currently it is possible to create tokens via the REST API only.

This is request to have this available through the UI while having the option to configure parameters similar to what is possible on the REST.

column1: Expose storage activity (throughput, upload, download)
column39:
A request to expose the storage activity done. This should be displayed on the Artifactory in the UI.

E.g. file-uploading to S3, FS throughput, binary exchanges throughput between Artifactory nodes.

column1: Expose on startup the files that Artifactory tries to load
column39:
There are required files that needs to be present as part of a successful upgrade. 
This is request to expose them all in the startup log, and/or by documentation.

column1: When deleting repositories - make the repo name about to deleted - bolder
column39: Currently the name is displayed but in order to avoid mistakes, this is a request to make the repository about to be deleted be marked in bold text or other means.

column1: Mimetype for Terraform state files
column39:
Hashicorp Terraform supports using Artifactory as backend storage for state files, which are in JSON format and have externstion _tfstate_.

[https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/index.html#format]

[https://www.terraform.io/docs/backends/types/artifactory.html]

Adding this extension to the default mimetypes file for JSON would allow viewing the file source directly in Artifactory UI without having to maintain a 1-line customization.

column1: "Included repositories" display area is mediocre
column39:
The "Included Repositores" display area truncates the name of anything but the smallest repository name. It also lists the repositories horizontally for some strange reason and that seems unintuitive.

As a bonus, if work is done to make this area of the Web UI better, it would also be useful to visually indicate which repository is configured as the "Default deploy to" repository for virtual repos.

 

!image002.png!

column1: Request to reduce and allow to configure the timeout for loading a smart remote repository settings page
column39:
Request to lower the timeout or improve the smart remote repository UI detection mechanism in order to prevent issues related to connection topics such as socket timeouts.

*The scenario and implications*:

When browsing to a *smart* remote repository it could take considerable time to load the remote repository page if the socketTimeout configured for the remote repository is high. Also if the load balancer is timing out requests that have a short socketTimeout it could be fail the UI load request with a 50x error.

Specifically the *discoversmartrepocapabilities* UI endpoint is taking prolonged time and therefore might fail the remote repository settings page loading.
The request that is triggered as a result of it to the remote repository endpoint is *api/system/version* as in the screenshot below which is dependent on the socketTimeout configured for the remote repository for a repository with 6 min timeout defined.

column1: Allow customising fields and details displayed under the UI repositories page
column39:
It would be helpful to see additional details for repositories without going into reach repository Advanced settings. 

One example would be having being able to see what proxy is defined for each remote repository.

column1: Chef / Ansible / Puppet - Installation and Upgrade examples
column39:
This task is to have on our GitHub some examples for automated installations / upgrades of Artifactory / HA.

Once we have these, they should be kept maintained in case there are changes in installation or upgrade process.

I believe the most common and requested script types will be: Chef, Ansible, Pupput.

column1: Validate yum remote metadata in Artifactory
column39:
Artifactory should validate remote metadata when fetching new repomd.xml. It should pull down the relevant files and ensure that they match what repomd.xml has.

If they don't match, it should rollback to the previous version and keep serving stale metadata.

column1: Allow group name bigger than 64 characters
column39: Currently, you cannot create a group name longer than 64 characters. There should be a way to increase this limit.

column1: Cleanup repository for PHP Composer repositories
column39:
In the maven repository configuration page, we have the ability to activate the cleanup of repository referenced in POMs.

*It could be nice to have the same feature for PHP Composer repositories*. We use Drupal 8 framework and some external repositories are declared in the file composer.json. So when building a project, artifactory is ignored.

column1: Show Replication Details on the Target Instance
column39:
Currently, there is no straightforward way to see what are the replications set up on the target node's perspective. 

It would be a nice feature to see what are the instance, repositories which are being currently configured to replicate to the a specific node.

column1: Delete release bundle request - lack of error codes
column39: In case of 400 errors we should have an error code in order to differentiate between the errors.

column1: Ability to clone LDAP setting
column39:
Following ticket #83107: 

 

We are using Artifactory LDAP functions to identify to our Active Directory.

We make an LDAP setting per team accessing the Artifactory, so each time a new team needs acces we need to clone the LDAP settings and just modify a little bit the filters. 

is there a way to easily clone an LDAP setting (not editing the XML configuration), for example a "duplicate button" ?

This feature has to be in the WebUI (not XML / YAML / JSON ) based.

column1: Column resizing not saving for entries of search tool
column39:
Every time we search something in Artifactory, result get displayed. Entire width is divided equally among all columns. Second, third and fourth column string is small and are less important, still they are getting displayed properly. First column *Image* (which is most important) is not getting displayed completely. Initial string in first column is path only, actual image name will be at last, which is most important. Why would developer want to see common path? Every time we have increase the width of *image* column. Even more irritating is that increased column width is not getting saved. Every time we do refresh or search for new string, column resizing will be gone and we will have to resize again. This is really a irritating. Please do fix it.

The things which can be done here are:
1) Image column can already have more width as compared to other column
2) If we resize the column, it should be saved. Even after logout and login back as well, we should see saved width for that column.
3) There should be an option to add or remove columns, so that I can add important columns and remove not required one.

column1: Support Docker registry mirror
column39:
Official documentation: [https://docs.docker.com/registry/recipes/mirror/]

This is actually working with Artifactory when proxying docker-hub, however, with local repositories or other remote sources there are some issues.

The issue is that is automatically adding the "library" within the URL in the request for the image. This is good with docker-hub, and will work with other destinations that a "library" prefix.

The official Docker documentation states: "It’s currently not possible to mirror another private registry. Only the central Hub can be mirrored."

Therefore there might be a limitation from the client.

column39: Remove Artifactory session by using tokens

column1: Oracle JDK as a remote repository
column39:
We would like to know that, Is there a way to configure the remote repository for downloading Oracle JDK versions as a rpm package? 

Also based on a discussion with Jfrog support, we are raising this request as an improvement request. Please find the ticket ID for your reference as well - 82822

column1: Reloading plugins with properties files does not reflect any changes on property file
column39:
Steps to reproduce: 

1. Install the [artifactCleanup|https://github.com/JFrogDev/artifactory-user-plugins/tree/master/cleanup/artifactCleanup] plugin with the properties file with it 
2. Reload the [plugins|http://example.com] 
3. Change the properties file to use a different cron. 
4. Reload the plugins again. You will receive the following response:

"Nothing to reload. All plugins are up to date.%". 

This happens due to the change was done on the properties file and not on the groovy file.

column1: Improve LDAP reliability by retrying if the connection fails
column39:
# When the configuration specifies an LDAP URL that uses a DNS name with multiple IP addresses, continue trying the other IPs if the first one fails or times out, instead of simply denying access (which causes builds to fail).
 # Even if the LDAP URL uses a DNS name with only one IP address, it would still be helpful to retry the connection in case of a temporary network issue or LDAP server performance problem.  Ideally the timeout/retry behavior would be configurable.

Example:

ldap://ldap.americas.mycompany.com:389

Where DNS name ldap.americas.mycompany.com returns multiple IP addresses like:

192.168.23.56

192.168.11.101

192.168.40.99

Currently, Artifactory will try to connect to the first IP, but if that LDAP server is down, unresponsive, or unreachable, it appears that the authentication request is failed right away without retrying, even if the other LDAP server IPs are alive and well.  This will typically result in seemingly random build failures when one of the LDAP servers is offline.  For instance: [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-deploy-plugin:2.7:deploy (default-deploy) on project

Reliability could be improved by trying, in sequence, each of the IP addresses returned by DNS until a responsive server is found, and/or including a configurable retry/timeout mechanism.

Granted, there are some potential workarounds, such as creating a separate LDAP configuration in Artifactory for each LDAP server IP, or using a GSLB, or a floating IP for LDAP, but many other tools and services automatically try to connect to each IP returned by DNS so that is the behavior that many users expect.
column252: 24/May/18 1:49 PM;ken.martindale;Further, creating a separate LDAP configuration in Artifactory for each LDAP server IP that serves the same directory is not a viable workaround, because groups and permissions are mapped per-configuration, which would make assigning permissions in such an environment unnecessarily complex and unsustainable.

column1: Be able to skip metadata calculation on deletes based on request parameter (or similar)
column39:
We cleaned a lot of artifacts recently and after each delete the maven metadata recalculation task was put into the queue. This filled up the queue and Artifactory had severe problems with that for deployments etc.

Our workaround was on HA setup to change a property on the master node to skip the metadata calculation after deletes on this node. We also had to detach the master node from the haproxy to not interfere with normal production.

After the huge cleanup was done I had to remove the setting again and restart artifactory once again.

But it would make sense to have a header or a query parameter on the DELETE call which instructs Artifactory to not trigger a metadata recalculation on this call.

Or the metadata calculation could be smarter and look if there are similar tasks in the queue and skip some of them as they are not needed. But the skip approach would work for us.

column1: Add "test mode" for instance
column39:
We often recreate our test based on the Artifactory production data to test our automation and other changes. It would be useful to have a configuration property in a file that is read at startup to disable all external communication from the moment a server starts.

Some of the things we have to disable now:
 * sending of e-mail notifications to users
 * standard replication
 * security and build replication based on plugins (the configuration also gets restored with production values)
 * ... and maybe other things that we didn't think of/notice till now

We know this is already possible through the admin UI or API, but there is always a chance that something already starts at the moment the server is started and before you can disable it there. It would be easy to avoid this with a property file to configure. The automation is aware that the instance being installed is in test, set a property to run the Artifactory in test mode and all replication, e-mails etc are disabled from the start.

Another advantage of using a property file: it won't be overwritten when you import a new backup from production.

column1: Show a warning in the UI when Artifactory is close to its EOL date or expired
provide more intuitive way to show URL cached docker images
column39:
When a image is resolved from a remote docker repository (e.g. docker-remote) it will be cached in the -cache repository (docker-remote-cache).  

The UI and copy repository path shows the URL as docker-remote-cache which is incorrect, and the subsequent request would be:

_docker pull docker-remote-cache.localhost/ubuntu:latest_

This returns a 404.

The correct request/URL is:

_docker pull docker-remote.localhost/ubuntu:latest_

The UI should display a correct, resolvable URL for users to use.

column1: Permission to recalculate index
column39:
Hello,

The permissions in artifactory are describe here :

[https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Managing+Permissions]

We don't see who can recalculate index of a repository.
After check, we can affirm that recalculate index need "manage" permission.
We would prefer to have this permission linked to "delete/overwrite" permission or a new one.

The "manage" permission allow to change the permission target :(

Regards,

Richard

column1: Yum upgrade of Artifactory or RPM upgrade should only change ownership of files that are not owned by "artifactory" user
column39:
Yum upgrade of Artifactory or RPM upgrade should only change ownership of files that are not owned by "artifactory" user during the upgrade. Currently the yum installer runs a chown on the entire $ARTIFACTORY_HOME/ folder recursively and since the filestore also exists under the $ARTIFACTORY_HOME/ this can take very long time on Secure Linux systems.

As the "filestore" contains all the binaries the "chown" can take a long time to complete on secure systems where it is an audited event and generated a lot of syslog messages.

Instead of running chown recursively to set the "artifactory" user as owner on all files and folders under $ARTIFACTORY_HOME/ we should find the files that are not owned by "artifactory" user and "chown" only those files.
column252:
20/Aug/19 11:13 PM;ken.martindale;I'm not sure if doing a find would really be that much faster because it still has to traverse every entry.  Perhaps on a secure system.

Regardless, we have very large Artifactory servers (tens of TBs and tens of millions of binaries) and the chown is by far the longest step in our software upgrade process.  It can take an hour or more to complete, and may not even actually change the ownership of a single file.  I'd prefer to just do the find and/or chown myself at my own convenience (if it's really even needed) instead of stalling the installation of the RPM for an hour while it runs a chown on 30 million files.

column1: Access Client/Server version mismatch warning logged too much
column39:
When there's a version mismatch between Access client and server, the client logs a warning for each request.
For Platform services, this would mean every REST request will trigger a warning.

The warning should be limited.

[WARN ] (o.j.a.c.h.AccessHttpClient:130) - Access client/server version mismatch. Client version: 3.3.0, Server version: 3.2.0

column1: Need to clean the DB and remove all of the old tables that Access replaced
column39:
Since using Access as the authentication provider, Artifactory holds unused tables in the database. For example:

USERS table was replaced with ACCESS_USERS table but the USERS table still exists in the DB.

GROUPS table was replaced with ACCESS_GROUPS table but the GROUPS table still exists in the DB.
etc... 

We need to check which tables are obsolete and remove them from the DB.

column1: Add extra information on the LDAP Group Settings (like a tooltip)
column39: We need to add extra information on the LDAP Group setting in the LDAP configuration page

column1: Custom Layout  requires wildcard in the GAVC REST search
column39:
Custom Layout  requires wildcard in the GAVC REST search

 

+Steps to reproduce+

*1.create customized layout (adding submodule)*

Artifact Path Pattern: [orgPath]/[module](/[submodule<[a-zA-Z0-9]+>])/[baseRev](/[folderItegRev])/[module]-[-baseRev-](-[fileItegRev])(-[classifier]).[ext]

 

_Snippet from config descriptor_

<repoLayout>

            <name>*maven-test1*</name>

            <artifactPathPattern>[orgPath]/[module](/[submodule<[a-zA-Z0-9]+>])/[baseRev](/[folderItegRev])/[module]-[baseRev](-[fileItegRev])(-[classifier]).[ext]</artifactPathPattern>

            <distinctiveDescriptorPathPattern>false</distinctiveDescriptorPathPattern>

            <descriptorPathPattern>[orgPath]/[module](/[os_version<[a-zA-Z0-9._-]+>])(/[submodule<[a-zA-Z0-9]+>])/[baseRev](/[folderItegRev])/[module]-[baseRev](-[fileItegRev])(-[classifier]).[ext].pom</descriptorPathPattern>

            <folderIntegrationRevisionRegExp>SNAPSHOT</folderIntegrationRevisionRegExp>

            <fileIntegrationRevisionRegExp>SNAPSHOT|(?:(?:[0-9]

{8}

.[0-9]

{6}

)-(?:[0-9]+))</fileIntegrationRevisionRegExp>

        </repoLayout>

 

2. *create a repository*

Repo key : maven-test

Repo Layout : maven-test1

 

3.  *upload a file via UI*

Target repository : maven-test

check mark for Deploy According To Layout

orgPath : org/test/com

module : artfact

submodule:  sub

baseRev : 1.0

folderItegRev : 

fileItegRev : SNAPSHOT

ext : jar

 

4. GAVC search REST API only works when * added with g and v options

    (Note : package search (maven GAVC) via Admin->UI is working properly)

curl -uadmin:password "http://mill.jfrog.info:34720/artifactory/api/search/gavc?a=artfact&repos=maven-test&g=org.test.com&v=1.0"

{   "results" : [ ] }

curl -uadmin:password "http://mill.jfrog.info:34720/artifactory/api/search/gavc?a=artfact&repos=maven-test&g=org.test.com&v=*1.0*"

{   "results" : [ ] }

curl -uadmin:password "http://mill.jfrog.info:34720/artifactory/api/search/gavc?a=artfact&repos=maven-test&g=org.test.com*&v=**1.0**"

{

  "results" : [

{     "uri" : "http://mill.jfrog.info:34720/artifactory/api/storage/maven-test/org/test/com/artfact/sub/1.0/artfact-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar"   }

]

}

column1: NuGet Remote Repository cannot process extra XML options
column39:

 # See a "404 Not Found" error, but there is an error in the Artifactory logs:

{noformat}

column1: Add ability to encrypt binarystore.xml passwords
column39:
Artifactory has the ability to encrypt values in db.properties. It seems that it does not provide the ability to encrypt values in binarystore.xml. It would be great if the credentials section of our s3 configuration in the binarystore.xml file was encrypted.

 
{code:java}
<config version="v1">
 <chain template="s3"/>
 <provider id="s3" type="s3">
   <identity>my_id</identity>
   <credential>ENCRYPT_ME</credential> 
   <endpoint>myendpoint</endpoint>
   <bucketName>mybucket</bucketName>
   <httpsOnly>true</httpsOnly>
   <property name="s3service.disable-dns-buckets" value="true"></property> 
 </provider>
</config>{code}

column1: Quiesce support - simplify backups
column39:
One of our Artifactory Pro is growning quick in matter of storage usage, we have many projects that are handling binaries (not ordinary JAVA, C# projects).

We have used the build in backup solution, but since the size (4,5 TB and will grow a lot more) this is to slow. When talking to our infrastructure department at our company they can help us with taking block snapshots very quick, but we need to ensure that no existing writing is in progress when we perform this to ensure that the backups are perfectly valid. It would be nice to have something like "apache2ctl -k graceful" to complete ongoing sessions but do not allow to spawn new ones.

It would be great to have quiesce support in Artifactory
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quiesce|http://example.com]

We could then simple trigger this from REST API
 # enableQuiesce
 # verifyNoWritingOperationInProgress
 # perform storage snapshot
 # disableQuiesce

 

BR Jörgen

column1: Show Virtual Repository Association in Included Repositories List
column39:
In virtual repository edit configurations, In the list showing all repositories included in the current virtual repository due to including other virtual repositories, a small text field can be added to show which virtual repository contains which other repositories by extension.


In the example below, there are 3 repositories: virtual1, virtual2 and virtual4. virtual1 contains the generic-local, testrepo, maventest and bintray-docker-remote repositories, virtual2 contains the testrepo, docker-local and bintray-docker-remote repositories, and virtual4 contains the virtual1 and virtual2 repositories (which means that by extension it contains the generic-local, testrepo, maventest, docker-local and bintray-docker-remote repositories).
Currently, there is no indication on which virtual repositories include the extended repositories, but a small text field, as shown in the screenshot, or any other way to display the information, can be added to make it easier to know which virtual repositories contain the extended repositories.

column1: Assume offline on remote repository has no indication on repository edit page
column39:
In case that you have a remote repository that for some reason got into 'assume offline' state, you have no way to know that unless you look at the artifactory.log.

Also, in addition to the above, in case that the issue with the remote repository is fixed, you have no option to get out of the 'assume offline' state unless you check it as offline, save, edit again, remove the offline, and save again. 

 

What is needed:
 # In case a repository got into an 'assume offline' state, the UI should show it on the repository config level. 
 # In case a repository got into an 'assume offline' state, there should be a button that releases the repository from that state (zap offline mode). 

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create remote repository to another Artifactory instance and set wrong credentials. 
 # Set replication to the remote repository and trigger it.
 # The repository is on 'assume offline' state. 
 # You will see no indication in the UI under the repository configuration. 
 # You can't get out from that state, on demand, unless doing the following:
 ## Edit the repository
 ## Check the 'Offline" checkbox.
 ## Save
 ## Edit the repository
 ## Uncheck the 'Offline' checkbox.
 ## Save.

column1: Push Replication does not maintain the image/artifact deployer
column39:
SETUP :
 - Create 'test-sync' as admin user in source-artifactory & target-artifactory
 - Create 'docker-prod-local' repo in source-artifactory & target-artifactory
 - Setup a push replication for 'docker-prod-local', replicating FROM source-artifactory TO target-artifactory. *Attached screenshot '78746-Replication-Setup.png'*
 - We have 'admin' user in the replication setup

Steps to reproduce the client use-case :
 - Setup a jenkins job to deploy the image to source-artifactory
 - Use 'test-sync' user in jenkins to deploy the image to source-artifactory
 - On successful run of jenkins job, we will see the image inside 'docker-prod-local' repo in source-artifactory
 - The 'Image-folder'/'Build-Number' node inside 'docker-prod-local' repo will have the following property -> Deployed By: 'test-sync'. *Attached screenshot '78746-Source-Artifactory-Actual.png'*
 - Manually replicate the 'docker-prod-local' repo FROM source-artifactory TO target-artifactory

EXPECTED RESULT :
 - The 'Image-folder'/'Build-Number' node inside 'docker-prod-local' repo on the target-artifactory will have the following property -> Deployed By: 'test-sync'

ACTUAL RESULT :
 - The 'Image-folder'/'Build-Number' node inside 'docker-prod-local' repo on the target-artifactory will have the following property -> Deployed By: 'admin'. *Attached screenshot '78746-Target-Artifactory-Actual.png'*

column1: Upgrade Java version in Docker images to support Let's Encrypt certificates
column39:
Hi,

it seems that the Artifactory docker image has problems connecting to Xray when Let's Encrypt certifaces are used.

Both Artifactory and Xray are running in a Kubernetes cluster and are available at https URLs with valid Let's Encrypt certs.

When, in Xray, I set the Base URL to [http://|http://.../]xray.mydomain the conenction to Artifactory works fine.

When I set the Base URL to [https://|https://.../]xray.mydomain the connection fails with this error message in the Artifactory logs:
{code:java}
Failed to propagate event to xray server at 'https://xray.mydomain' : sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target.{code}
 

That's propably because of the java version used in the Artifactory docker image:
{code:java}
/docker-java-home/bin/java -version openjdk version "1.8.0_131"{code}
 

I ran a small java test script in the container to verify this. The script just calls the xray https URL and throws this error:
{code:java}
/docker-java-home/bin/java TestSecuredConnection
javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.secur
ity.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target
       at sun.security.ssl.Alerts.getSSLException(Alerts.java:192)
       at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.fatal(SSLSocketImpl.java:1949)
       at sun.security.ssl.Handshaker.fatalSE(Handshaker.java:302)
       at sun.security.ssl.Handshaker.fatalSE(Handshaker.java:296)
       at sun.security.ssl.ClientHandshaker.serverCertificate(ClientHandshaker.java:1514)
       at sun.security.ssl.ClientHandshaker.processMessage(ClientHandshaker.java:216)
       at sun.security.ssl.Handshaker.processLoop(Handshaker.java:1026)
       at sun.security.ssl.Handshaker.process_record(Handshaker.java:961)
       at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.readRecord(SSLSocketImpl.java:1062)
       at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.performInitialHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1375)
       at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1403)
       at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.startHandshake(SSLSocketImpl.java:1387)
       at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsClient.afterConnect(HttpsClient.java:559)
       at sun.net.www.protocol.https.AbstractDelegateHttpsURLConnection.connect(AbstractDelegateHttpsURLConnection.
java:185)
       at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.connect(HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java:153)
       at TestSecuredConnection.testConnectionTo(TestSecuredConnection.java:30)
       at TestSecuredConnection.main(TestSecuredConnection.java:16)
Caused by: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunC
ertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target
       at sun.security.validator.PKIXValidator.doBuild(PKIXValidator.java:387)
       at sun.security.validator.PKIXValidator.engineValidate(PKIXValidator.java:292)
       at sun.security.validator.Validator.validate(Validator.java:260)
       at sun.security.ssl.X509TrustManagerImpl.validate(X509TrustManagerImpl.java:324)
       at sun.security.ssl.X509TrustManagerImpl.checkTrusted(X509TrustManagerImpl.java:229)
       at sun.security.ssl.X509TrustManagerImpl.checkServerTrusted(X509TrustManagerImpl.java:124)
       at sun.security.ssl.ClientHandshaker.serverCertificate(ClientHandshaker.java:1496)
       ... 12 more
Caused by: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to re
quested target
       at sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilder.build(SunCertPathBuilder.java:141)
       at sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilder.engineBuild(SunCertPathBuilder.java:126)
       at java.security.cert.CertPathBuilder.build(CertPathBuilder.java:280)
       at sun.security.validator.PKIXValidator.doBuild(PKIXValidator.java:382)
       ... 18 more{code}
 

I don't see importing the missing CA certs into the keystore as an option.
Let's encrypt certs are not something exceptional anymore, but state of the art. I think that any software should support them by now.

See ticket #78832 for reference.

Best,
Frank

column1: Replicator - support more package types
Improve Closest Blob Info for maven
Provide interface similar to clusterDump that provides public IPs for HA members
column39:
Would like to get a list of the Artifactory server IPs so they can be whitelisted on an external firewall, in an automated fashion, when Artifactory is running in a HA cluster.

This would be against Cloud/SaaS, you could potentially use clusterDump, however, this provides internal (private non-addressable) IPs only.

Should be an equivalent, or similar, that provides all RT servers publicly addressable IPs.

column1: Better caching of BlobInfo
column39:
When using Distribution flow not all BlobInfos are being cached.
Example:

*replicate v1*
# blob info of v1 is being queried on source
# blob info of v1 is being cached on source

*replicate v2*
# blob info of v2 is being queried on source (cache miss) 
# blob info of v2 is cached on source
# blob info of v1 (closest) is being queried on target (cache miss)

We shall cache blob info of v1 on target after/during the replication of v1 in a non blocking way

column1: Allow "Can Update Profile" setting to be enabled by default without requiring SSO
column39:
With LDAP authentication enabled and the auto-create user option set to true, we find that user profiles created do not have the "Can Update Profile" option enabled by default.  This impedes the ability for users to take advantage of features like API Keys and SSH Authentication.  We would like to see an enhancement for the features below.  The Update User REST API isn't really an option at this point since the API requires multiple fields to be included.  Thanks

* Allow "Can Update Profile" to be defaulted to true or false for LDAP accounts with auto-create enabled.
* Create an option to bulk update multiple user accounts to enable or disable the "Can Update Profile" feature at once.

31/Mar/18 5:36 PM;msawkar@qti.qualcomm.com;Nevermind, cleared the browser cache and the checkbox showed up on the LDAP config page.

See Jfrog support issue #77288

column1: Missing Xray tab when clicking on an artifact in a virtual repository
column39:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a virtual repository.
2. Create a local repository.
3. Add the local repository to virtual repository.
4. Add the local repository Xray.
5. In the local repository configure that artifacts download will be blocked according to"Block Downloads With Severity Above"
6. Deploy an artifact with vulnerabilities that can be blocked by Xray.

Click on the artifact via the local repository and the following message will appear:
{code:java}
Xray has detected issues on this artifact, and it has been blocked for download and distribution
{code}

Click on the artifact via the virtual repository, there is no message regarding it.

Please note that the artifact cannot be downloaded from both virtual and local repository as expected regardless of the message appearance.

column1: JVM arguments to be clean when passing them as extra environment variables

column1: If a configured Service Provider does not match the one sent in the Assertion - inform the user about this
column39: If there's a mismatch between certificates set on Artifactory and one sent on the SAML assertion, a generic message 'Failed to verify signature' is sent to the user. We should better inform the users about this needed change.

column39:

Can you put in a function where I can put in an Access Token through the API, and it will return the following?
Username, Token ID, Issue Date, Expire Date, Refresh, Scope, Grant Type, and Audience?

Thanks.

column1: export repository with after select date
column39:
Hi~

I use two artifactory oss that internet and intranet.
intranet artifactory import repository after internet artifactory export repository .
internet artifactory respository growing more size and export repository size very big size
but today added artifact few files but repository export all artifact export.

add improvement  "export repository with after select date"
column252:
21/Mar/18 4:53 PM;krihelis;Hello, 

In order to achieve this, you can use *Backups*. In the UI, go to the Admin module > Backups. 
When creating a backup, check 'Incremental' - (taken from the [Artifactory User Guide|https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Managing+Backups#ManagingBackups-CompleteSystemBackup]) When set, this backup should be incremental. In this case, only changes from the previous run will be backed up, so the process is very fast.
The backup directory name will be called current (as opposed to using the timestamp)
The backup files can be used by any incremental file-system based backup utility (such as rsync).

You can then use this export when importing on the intranet Artifactory instance. 

Hope that helps.

column1: Groups in Artifactory are allowed to contain special characters

Groups in Artifactory are allowed to be created with many special characters including spaces and "," which makes integration with other products internal (bintray, access etc') and external hard.

column1: support docker latest tag on full mesh topology architecture
column39:
Using a full-mesh multi-push replication scheme. There are 2 datacenters each with 2 local repositories for each datacenter along with a virtual repository that stitches them all together:

Datacenter A
    repo-A
    repo-B (read only)
    repo (virtual of repo-A, repo-B, default repository is repo-A for writes)
Datacenter B
    repo-A (read only)
    repo-B
    repo (virtual of repo-A, repo-B, default repository is repo-B for writes)

Then, creating docker images and tagging them with latest causes inconsistencies:

Built in Datacenter A:
docker build -t my/image:1.0
docker push my/image:1.0
docker tag my/image:1.0 my/image:latest
docker push my/image:latest

Built in Datacenter B:
docker build -t my/image:1.1
docker push my/image:1.1
docker tag my/image:1.1 my/image:latest
docker push my/image:latest

After replication occurs, trying to resolve the latest tag from datacenter A resolves the latest which is actually version 1.0.

column1: Create remote repository type for https://updates.jenkins.io/
column39:

Artifactory is unable to host *https://updates.jenkins.io*/ as a remote registry for the Jenkins plug-ins update server due to *update-center.json* having hardcoded URL's

It would be really useful if artifactory could interpret this file and re-write the URLS to the Artifactory server address.

And provide this as an additional Remote connection type

column1: Support integration with Gerrit as private Bower repository
column39:
Currently, Artifactory lets you integrate with git-based private repositories, in order to install private Bower packages.

[Gerrit|https://www.gerritcodereview.com/] is an on-prem code review system *for* Git.
The path and layout are different than GitHub, for example. As a result, Artifactory won't let the user register and download packages that are located in Gerrit.

column1: docker pull return 400 instead of 401 or 403 in case of permissions
column39:
Currently, when trying to pull a docker image with include exclude pattern we received the following error:*_
Error: Status 400 trying to pull repository testproject: "{\r\n  \"errors\" : [ {\r\n    \"status\" : 400,\r\n    \"message\" : \"Unsupported docker v1 repository request for 'docker-test'\"\r\n  } ]\r\n}"_*
Instead of 401 or 403 error code. 
Steps to reproduce :
1. Create a new docker repository with include Pattern for the repository(for example aa) 
2. Try to pull an image that doesn't contain the pattern and you will receive the 400 error.
column252:
13/Feb/18 12:21 PM;imre.pem;To clarify the description: It is the permission via the user tries to access the Docker repo, not the repo itself that has include pattern.
Include patterns for docker repositories are quite useful, as they allow multiple teams to work with the same repo by using their own tags. So a (costly) wildcard certificate may not be necessary.

column1: addExtraConfFiles doesn't work in case of an upgrade process
column39:
You can see the following if statement ton the artifactory_extra_conf code : 

*addExtraConfFiles* () {
    logger "Adding extra configuration files to ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/etc if any exist"

    # If directory not empty
    if [ -d "${ARTIFACTORY_EXTRA_CONF}" ] && [ "$(ls -A ${ARTIFACTORY_EXTRA_CONF})" ]; then
        logger "Adding files from ${ARTIFACTORY_EXTRA_CONF} to ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/etc"
        cp -rfv ${ARTIFACTORY_EXTRA_CONF}/* ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/etc || errorExit "Copy files from ${ARTIFACTORY_EXTRA_CONF} to ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/etc failed"
    fi
}

# In case data dirs are missing or not mounted, need to create them
setupDataDirs () {
    logger "Setting up data directories if missing"
    if [ ! -d ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/etc ]; then
        mkdir -p ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/etc errorExit "Failed creating $ARTIFACTORY_DATA/etc"

        # Add extra conf files to a newly created etc/ only!
        *addExtraConfFiles*
    fi
    [ -d ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/data ]        || mkdir -p ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/data        || errorExit "Creating $ARTIFACTORY_DATA/data failed"
    [ -d ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/logs ]        || mkdir -p ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/logs        || errorExit "Creating $ARTIFACTORY_DATA/logs failed"
    [ -d ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/backup ]      || mkdir -p ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/backup      || errorExit "Creating $ARTIFACTORY_DATA/backup failed"
    [ -d ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/access ]      || mkdir -p ${ARTIFACTORY_DATA}/access      || errorExit "Creating $ARTIFACTORY_DATA/access failed"
    [ -d ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/run ]         || mkdir -p ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/run         || errorExit "Creating ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/run failed"
    [ -d ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/etc/plugins ] || mkdir -p ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/etc/plugins || errorExit "Creating ${ARTIFACTORY_HOME}/etc/plugins failed"
}


Therefore in case of an upgrade we will not copy the /etc folder
column252:
12/Feb/18 12:15 PM;eldada;The initial idea behind this was to allow adding custom configuration at initial setup of a new Artifactory Docker container.
In this request, comes a new requirement for using this mechanism for updating existing configurations and applying them by restarting the Docker container.
Technically, this is a simple change in sources - just run *addExtraConfFiles* every time the container starts.
The implication of such a change will be that changes made directly to files under *ARTIFACTORY_HOME/etc* might be overwritten by a restart of the container.

To be safe, we can add an environment variable to explicitly ask for overwriting configurations on restart (FORCE_EXTRA_CONF=true) and run *addExtraConfFiles* only if this flag is set. The default value of this variable will be *false*.

column1: Reverse Proxy Generator for Repository Path
column39:
In version 5.8.0 We have introduced the proxy-less Docker option known as "Repository Path".

Users would like to be able to configure a reverse proxy even for using Repository Path because:

- They want to keep it secure with SSL.
- They can't use a wildcard certificate as required in the sub-domain method.

This leaves them with the "Ports" method which is not comfortable, as every created repository needs to be added manually.

Configure a reverse-proxy by using the Path method will be very useful in these usecases, and we should provide a configuration example.

column1: User should be able to revoke his own Access tokens
column39:
Currently user is not able to revoke Access Tokens that are associated to him.
This is even if he created them.

If a user has created an Access Token, he should be able to revoke the token himself without involving an admin.

column1: Tomcat version in shown in broken page
column39: If you open a link on your Artifactory server which does not exists the Tomcat version is shown in the error message (see screenshot). This information can be used to look for known vulnerabilities and attack the server. There should be an option for this information to be removed.

column1: Add support for ECS task roles
column39:
S3 offers [IAM roles for tasks|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/task-iam-roles.html] that apply to an ECS container. These roles can be used inside the container and work just like roles for EC2. At the moment Artifactory does not support these and fails to start up when one is specified.

Workaround/Alternatives:

* Use credentials
* Use the EC2s role (assuming it has S3 access)

column1: Allow anonymous access for Docker _catalog or other API requests
column39:
Since 5.2.1, with anonymous access enabled, you still need to authenticate for the v2/_catalog request due to:

Artifactory is now aligned with the Docker spec and returns an authentication challenge for each Docker endpoint (even when anonymous access is enabled). This means that when using internal Artifactory Docker endpoints, you must first retrieve an authentication token which must then be used for all subsequent calls by your Docker client. 

curl http://10.6.17.221:8081/artifactory/api/docker/v2/_catalog -k
{"errors":[{"code":"UNAUTHORIZED","message":"authentication required","detail":null}]}

There should be a way to perform this call anonymously.
column252: 23/Mar/18 10:12 PM;lance.johnston;Just ran into this. How is it that curling this endpoint must be authenticated, but the docker client has no issues with anonymous pulls, pushes, etc.?

column1: $ARTIFACTORY_HOME/logs/ to have a link to $ACCESS_HOME/logs/
column39:
This feature is to have the access logs as a directory under the Artifactory logs, similar to the way we currently have the 'Catalina' folder and tomact logs.

This will help because:
- We will have 1 place for all Artifactory related logs.
- The Access logs will be automatically part of the Support Bundle.

While Access is a different service, it comes hand in hand with Artifactory.
The Catalina directory stores information that is relevant for both applications, therefore it only makes sense to have the Access logs there as well.

column1: API Key/Password Management and expiry
column39:
We have business users who use this product for using R and currently they have to update their API key every x days as per our password policy. This is confusing for them and an unnecessary overhead.

It would be good if we could tailor the expiry of the key so that we could either link it to the expiry of the users password in AD, or on removal of the user from the organisation or AD Group. 

thanks

column1: Allow easy UI certificate upload and association for remote repositories
column39:
Currently, in order to import self-signed certificates, an import of the needed certificate to the JVM keyStore (trustStore) would needed be done via the JDK's provided `keytool` CLI command. Then restarting Artifactory would be needed in order to for it to be applied.

Having an option to easily upload and import a certificate for a remote repository which uses, e.g., a self signed/internal CA signed certificate would ease on this process.

This will also provide more secure means of certificates management, both from system management perspective as well as separation from the JVM keyStore (Artifactory has it's own keyStore stored in the database).

column1: Replication between generic repositories should optionally allow replication of metadata files
column39:
Currently, if you are replicating between generic repositories, some metadata files like maven-metadata.xml are not replicated. There should be an option to replicate these files. 

The general use case would be for generic repositories being used as an archival file storage system (such as using it instead of a NAS share). In that case maven-metadata.xml is just an arbitrary file that happens to have semantical meaning attached to its name for maven artifacts. If I had some arbitrary file storage that I threw my files on to I would expect it to work the same in artifactory as well. They should not disappear on me based on the artifactory site that I am downloading from.

As a concrete example consider using artifactory as the storage system for archiving portions of Jenkins build workspaces. This could happen if workspaces need to be passed between jobs as well as for debugging purposes. It's not ideal and but it happens. If the workspace contained some maven-metadata.xml file it would be awkward if the user/job consuming the workspace behaves differently based on where it is located due to other locations missing files. We are not in this situation today but we do have a backlog item to investigate using artifactory as a generic file store as the default Jenkins mechanism stores the files on disk which take a lot of space and slow the system down.

Since this could potentially break people that erroneously use generic or other repository types for maven artifacts instead of the maven type any change would have to be a configurable option system level or the repository level.

column1: REST API for user updating SSH public key
column39: We have automation to create CI users with UI access disabled and generated credentials populated into CI (Jenkins). We would like to expand this automation to include setting an SSH public key for the CI user so the private key can be used in CI pipelines with the jFrog CLI tool. I have no preference if admin can update SSH keys or if only the user can update their SSH key.

column1: Checksum Search should be case insensitive
column39:
While other searches are case sensitive, the checksum search should not be so.
In terms of checksums E6C89652FE2FF12F4DC53B42DCE019643307782C and e6c89652fe2ff12f4dc53b42dce019643307782c
are the same, therefore when searching using upper cases I would expect Artifactory to return the artifacts with this checksum.

If any other application shows checksums in uppercases, this makes it not comfortable to search, as I would first need to lower-case the string before searching it.

column39:

Checking inside the Jfrog Artifactory RPM file shows that all the files and directories permissions are like 0775 and 0664 or even more world-readable. Example:

column1: Promote Docker Image to Virtual Repository (API)
column39:
[Being able to use the "Docker Image Promotion" API and target a Virtual Repository as "targetRepo".
]
Probably this means being able to support the copy/move API to a virtual repository as well.

When targeting a virtual repository, we would expect the promotion/copy/move would be done to the Default Deployment Repository of the virtual repository.


This flow does not work for docker Api

curl -i -X POST   -H "Content-Type:application/json" -d \
'{
    "targetRepo" : "docker-virtual",                            
   "dockerRepository" : "centos",              
    "targetDockerRepository" : "centos" ,
      "tag" : "latest",                                
   "targetTag" : "latest2",                                
    "copy": true                                          
}' \
 'http://local/artifactory/api/docker/docker-local/v2/promote'
column252: 15/Feb/18 10:11 PM;mrichar2;+1. This is an issue that is apparent when using a full mesh multi-pull/push replication mechanism across multiple artifactory instances.

column1: Smart remote repo's sync properties also deletes existing properties
column39:
Server B is configured with a smart remote repository pointing to a repository on Server A.
The configuration includes the sync properties feature of smart remote repo.
Server B is configured with XRay and this remote repo is indexed by XRay.
Block unscanned artifacts is enabled on this repository.
The feature depends on the status of the xray properties set on artifacts on this repository.

Problem arises when the properties are synced from server A. Any change with the properties will be synced to Server B and will also delete the xray properties set on the artifact.
As a result the artifact will blocked to download.

In order to resolve this, need to trigger re-index from XRay again.

column1: Fix itests
Unclear Error Message while deleting Repository
column39:
When deleting a Remote Bower Repository we get the following Message from Artifactory:

{{Deleting repo '***' failed: Failed to read object from stream}}

As soon as we found an Virtual Bower Repo which still referenced this Remote Repo and deleted this, we could also delete the Remote Repo without further errors.

Assuming the above mentioned Error Message stems from not being able to delete Remote Repos still referenced in Virtual Repos (which would make sense), a more obvious Error Message like "Failed to delete Repo still referenced in virtual Repo "xxx"" would be appreciated.

column1: Support for SHA3 checksums
column39: Request to add the SHA3 checksum for all artifacts for validation, checksum search, checksum deploy.

column1: Storage summary in Gigabytes versus Gibibytes
column39:
The Storage summary in the *Admin --> Advanced --> Storage* is shown in gibibytes instead of gigabytes. 
 
The gibibytes are more accurate as they do not round off to the nearest higher value, but the OS level tools do, which causes a miss-match between the values shown when a df command is run on the mount point versus the artifactory storage summary. 

Changing the storage summary to gigabytes will be more accurate on most of the use-cases

column1: Display 64 Character Limitation for New Permission Target Name
column39:
If you go to *Artifactory UI --> Admin --> Permissions --> New Permission* and input a name longer than 64 characters, Artifactory will return a nondescriptive error.
 "Unexpected error has occurred please check the logs."

Under the Create or Replace Permission Target excerpt on the Artifactory API documentation (https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Artifactory+REST+API#ArtifactoryRESTAPI-CreateorReplacePermissionTarget), it is mentioned that it consumes *application/vnd.org.jfrog.artifactory.security.PermissionTarget+json*,  and only there (https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/Security+Configuration+JSON) you can see a mention of the name length limit of 62.

Artifactory and our documentation should indicate this limitation better.

column1: Web UI should request authentication for non-accessible repositories
column39:
When users are given a link to a specific artifact in the web UI, they may not be accessible to them due to not being logged in. In that case, Artifactory navigates user to the first accessible repository instead of asking for credentials. This is non-intuitive for users as they do not see artifacts they are supposed to see by following the link (and no error is raised).

Example: 
Try to navigate directly to https://artifactory-server/artifactory/webapp/#/artifacts/browse/tree/General/repository/path/to/artifact. Given that repository/path/to/artifact exists:
- logged in user with valid permission is presented the artifact,
- anonymous user without permission is silently presented first accessible repository.

Suggested behavior is to challenge user for credentials in case of present-but-not-accessible artifact. At the very least raise message for anonymous user that the artifact might be accessible if logged in.

column1: The indexing of filelists.xml for Yum repositories should always be enabled and it should not be optional
column39:
The indexing of filelists.xml for Yum repositories should always be enabled and it should not be optional. 

Starting from version 5.4 indexing of filelists.xml is disabled by default.

Improve Yum Metadata Calculation
column39:
Yum metadata should not get recalculated if an already existing checksum gets redeployed to the repo:

Reproduced on Artifactory 5.5.1: 
1. deploy rpm file to rpm repo: 
curl -uadmin -XPUT http://localhost:8081/artifactory/rpm-local/ -T art-1-test.rpm 

2. redeploy that same rpm file to the same repo:
curl -uadmin -XPUT http://localhost:8081/artifactory/rpm-local/ -T art-1-test.rpm
