column1: Show update date on Docker upper level packages.
column39:
Pushing a Docker image to local artifactory doesn't overwrite the existing image, for a given tag.
For example, pushing the <image name>:latest image on a developer's local machine doesn't overwrite the corresponding <image name>:latest image in local artifactory.
Instead, we see a silent failure when attempting that push.
Current workaround is to manually delete the relevant image from local artifactory, using the web UI, before pushing.
Note that we’re using the fabric8 docker maven plugin

Please see ticket number 65091 for details (Issue with Docker image overwrite failing for local artifactory).

column1: AOL | Cannot use export API on AOLs
column39: The current state is that the export API is necessary for the DevOps team in order to perform migrations, but is currently blocked for AOLs.

column1: New permissions options: separate user management and artifactory management
column39:
Due to compliance requirements, there is a request have additional segregated management accounts.  
There is a request for new permissions that expand on and are selected instead of admin:

* User management:  Users with this permission can manage users and permissions+permission targets, but are unable to make administrative changes to Artifactory (create repos, replication, backup, etc)

* Service Management: Users with this permission can manage repositories and other aspects of artifactory services (backup, replication, etc) but cannot manage users.

This use case comes from a security standpoint as to limit the risk that comes from an admin role having more permissions than some users need (e.g. LDAP admin who also manages artifactory only needs to manage users, and locking him out of other admin functions reduces risk should his account be compromised, etc.)

column1: File.canWrite is flaky
column39:
During the bootstrap process, Artifactory checks whether the data directory structure already exists and if it has write access to.

The issue is manifesting in some cases where the storage is NFS mounted. In this case, it might happen that the `File.canWrite()` shout a false response. 

The fix would be to replace that call with a File utility method that tests if it has write access by simply trying to write something at that location. If the write is successful, then write is truly permitted.

column1: allow common document names to be viewable via web ui
column39:
If a repository a text file with, for example, a name {{README.TXT}}, a user is able to click on the resource and select an option {{VIEW}} to see the document's contents.

For a series of common document names which do not define an extension, a user is unable to view them directly from the user interface. The workaround is to download the resource and view them manually. It would be ideal to include a series of unique artifact filenames to flagged as viewable via the web user interface. Common document names include:
* CHANGELOG
* CODE_OF_CONDUCT
* CONTRIBUTING
* COPYING
* LICENSE
* README

column1: Would like Delete and Overwrite to be different permissions
column39:
Artifactory 5.5.1

It would be nice if delete and overwrite were different permissions. I would like my CI system to be able to delete something or create something but not overwrite.

"But", you might say, "what prevents them from doing a delete followed by a create?"

Nothing really, is my answer, I just want it to be deliberate by having to explicitly delete first.
column252:
12/Jun/19 4:58 PM;mark.mielke;This has come up for us in the context of people that logically agree that overwrite is bad, but their workflow using tools such as Twine results in artifacts still being accidentally uploaded. This then cause all the typical downstream consequences of what happens when two different artifacts are published under the same name and version. This issue was referenced:

[https://github.com/pypa/twine/pull/363]

Twine has a "--skip-existing" flag, but it doesn't work unless Delete/Overwrite is disabled for the calling user. This means that in order for these users to work properly, they need to lose their Delete/Overwrite. The Overwrite isn't a concern in this case, but the Delete is. Now, they are no longer able to clean up old artifacts.

From a security standpoint only - Delete/Overwrite being one permission has merit. It's simple.

From an actual user workflow perspective, however, there are many different use cases where we might want to enforce that the user is only allowed to Delete and not Overwrite, or only allowed to Overwrite but not Delete. This isn't a security problem, but it is a process enforcement problem. Ensuring that users (and the tools they invoke) do the right thing.

Please separate these permissions.

This also blocks us from moving over remotes to cert based authentication between nodes without adding extra VHosts and URLs

column1: Support browsing tar.bz2 archives
Virtual Repository should check all aggregated repositories before responding
column39:
Currently there is no checksum policy for virtual repositories.
When aggregating few remote repositories, I would expect that in case one is returning a "409 checksum mismatch" it would try to resolve the artifact from the other remote in the virtual.

The current behavior, is that in case one of the remote responses with 409 this is your final response, instead of further checking for the artifact in the other aggregated repositories.

4. Shutdown secondary node

column1: add the option to run getLatestVersionByProperties api on a specific path only (without paths starting with the same name)
column39:
Use case:

In case you have a repository with 2 paths:
abc
abcd
And you want to get the latest version of an artifact under abc, but not under abcd.

Currently, if you run the search:
{code}
curl -uadmin:password "http://localhost:8081/artifactory/api/versions/test-repo/abc?listFiles=1"
{code}
The search includes all folders starting with 'abc' and will include 'abcd'.

column1: Have file available mapping all binary SHA1 sums to filenames
column39:
As an Artifactory HA installation grows in size it becomes more difficult to restore data if it's accidentally deleted.  The trash can is configurable for the permanent deletion period, but there are times when a request comes in to restore a file that's past that time range.

Restoring files from backups are pretty much impossible since filenames are converted to SHA1 sum names.  It would be nice if a feature were implemented where a flat file was generated that keeps SHA1 sum values mapped to the real filenames they're uploaded as.  That way we could refer to a backup and just pull the individual binary instead of trying to create a temporary instance and restoring the DB data so we can get that info.

We would like to understand your current policy on the trash can.
How did you configure your trash can, and what is the deletion period and how you currently backup your data.
 
We would like to understand why and what are the difficulties you have to restore files from backups.

column1: Improve docker's system ping to primary node
column39:
In entrypoint-artifactory.sh, it has a function (see "Details") to check whether primary node is up or not by using anonymous ping. If the primary node disabled anonymous access, then it fails to ping and results in installation failure.

Either document the possible error in the log or allow passing a username and a password/API-key for the system ping. 

h3. Work-around:
You may modify the entrypoint-artifactory.sh to remove the System Ping or add a credential to it. After customizing the file, you may create an additional mount on the docker-compose file, so the modified file is mapped to the image's /entrypoint-artifactory.sh. 


h3. Details: 

In entrypoint-artifactory.sh:

...
waitForPrimaryNode () {
    logger "Waiting for primary node to be up"

    local CMD="curl --silent --fail $ART_PRIMARY_BASE_URL/api/system/ping"
    logger "Running $CMD"
    while [ "$($CMD)" != "OK" ]; do
        logger "."
        sleep 4
    done

    logger "Primary node ($ART_PRIMARY_BASE_URL) is up!"
}
...

column1: API Endpoint for Downloading Bootstrap Bundle
column39:
Having the bootstrap bundle creation step via API is great. The bootstrap bundle is create in $ART_HOME/etc which a non-root/artifactory user cannot access. The file itself is set +rw artifactory:artifactory only. This means to download the bootstrap.bundle.tar.gz now, I need to ssh into the box, mv or cp file, and grant more open permissions so that I can rsync locally before sending them out to the nodes. Or I'd have to have root permission node to node via SSH, which is not advisable for security reasons.

As an authenticated Artifactory Admin user, I'd like to be able to download the bootstrap.bundle.tar.gz file via API.

column1: Enforce build number consistency when uploading snapshot POMs via a Virtual repo
column39:
When directly deploying POM files via virtual repo (with a Default Deployment Repo), a situation may occur where different versions of the same snapshot version is contained within different repos under the corresponding virtual repo, i.e:

└── virtual 
        ├── local1 .    - latest snapshot version is 1 (e.g. artifactId-2.1.0--20170830.165330-1.pom)
        └── local2 .    - latest snapshot version is 3 (e.g. artifactId-2.1.0--20170830.165330-3.pom)

Notice how local2 contains a more recent build number than local1 (3 vs. 1). When the maven client deploys (say to a virtual repo), it gets the maven-metadata.xml first, figures out which version is the latest, and then increments it. In other words Maven produces a valid build number since it sends an explicit unique snapshot path and doesn't rely on artifactory to generate it.  In this case, if the next deployment goes to local1, the next build number would still be *4*, which is good.

However, when deploying a snapshot POM to the same virtual repo using the SNAPSHOT keyword (i.e "artifactId-<2.1.0>-SNAPSHOT") via the REST API, Artifactory would increment the build number according to the last build number that exists on the local repo where the POM is deployed to, so using the above example, the build number would be 2. This behavior is expected and produces consistent build numbers when deploying directly to a local repo, however, since virtual repos are used nowadays for both deployments and resolution, deploying to a virtual repo should produce consistent build numbers too - i.e the REST should mimic the maven client behavior. 

A possible workaround would be changing the default snapshot version comparator to the TimestampSnapshotComparator which compares snapshot versions based on their timestamp rather than the build number, so even an inconsistent build number won't prevent resolution of the "latest" deployed POM -

artifactory.mvn.metadataSnapshotComparatorFqn=org.artifactory.maven.snapshot.TimestampSnapshotComparator

column1: When deleting from a stash results view, only delete from the view
column39:
When deleting from the stash results view, items only present in the view should be deleted. If you delete a parent folder in the view, it will delete folders and item within the view that match the search, as well as other items or folders NOT in the view that you don't want to be deleted.

For example, you have a "parent" folder in a search stash results view, with folders "1" and "2", in which only the "1" folder shows up in the stash view. In this situation, you only want the "1" folder to be deleted. However, if you delete the "parent" folder, both folder "1" and "2" will be deleted, even when only the "1" folder is showing up in the stash view and you want to keep the "2" folder. Deleting the "parent" folder should only delete the "1" folder which is present in the view, not the "2" folder as well since( the "2" folder isn't in the stash view).

To test:
-Create debian local repo
-deploy a file into /pool/c/test1/file1
-deploy a file into /pool/c/test2/file2
-Do a quick search for file1, and notice that pool/c/test1/file1 will be in the results
-When you delete the resulting parent pool/c/ folder expecting only to delete pool/c/test1/file1, you'll notice the test2 folder is deleted as well

Note: This seems to only happen with "Compress Empty Folders" unchecked, and is reproducible on the latest version

column1: Add a new text pattern index for the nodes table for the Quick Search queries
column39:
*This was tested specific for PostgreSQL* but could apply for additional DBs 

Adding a new text pattern index for the nodes table produced better results when a single & double wildcards are appended to the query below (SELECT...):

{code}create index idx_name_text on nodes (node_name text_pattern_ops){code}

*For an existing DB, use the* {code}concurrently{code} *statement to avoid locks*:
{code}create index concurrently idx_name_text on nodes (node_name text_pattern_ops){code}

*Results after adding it:*
{code}
postgres=# explain analyze SELECT nodes.node_id, nodes.node_type, nodes.repo, nodes.node_path, nodes.node_name FROM nodes WHERE nodes.node_type=1 AND  nodes.repo  != 'auto-trashcan' AND nodes.node_name LIKE 'a%'
;
                                                        QUERY PLAN
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Bitmap Heap Scan on nodes  (cost=6.53..731.46 rows=473 width=80) (actual time=0.091..0.668 rows=25 loops=1)
   Filter: (((repo)::text <> 'auto-trashcan'::text) AND ((node_name)::text ~~ 'a%'::text) AND (node_type = 1))
   Rows Removed by Filter: 105
   Heap Blocks: exact=59
   ->  Bitmap Index Scan on idx_name_text  (cost=0.00..6.41 rows=185 width=0) (actual time=0.055..0.055 rows=130 loops=1)
         Index Cond: (((node_name)::text ~>=~ 'a'::text) AND ((node_name)::text ~<~ 'b'::text))
 Planning time: 77.340 ms
 Execution time: 0.707 ms
(8 rows)
{code}

column1: Artifactory Docker Image(s) should support secrets
column39:

A better way would be to use Docker secrets. The official PostgreSQL image show cases how that can be achieved. They leave the choice to the user to provide the password via env property or secret definition.

More details can be found here: docker-library/postgres#111

Originated from:
https://github.com/JFrogDev/artifactory-docker-examples/issues/37#issuecomment-323564665

column1: Upgrade ivy dependency to 2.4
column39:
Current latest artifactory version (5.4.6) still depends on ivy-2.2.0.jar

When using user plugins such as ivy2pom (https://github.com/JFrogDev/artifactory-user-plugins/tree/master/descriptors/ivy2pom), this means that the parsing of Ivy descriptors is limited to versions up to 2.2.
(More details at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IVY-1565)

Upgrading to ivy-2.4.0.jar would have the significant benefit that all the Ivy descriptors could be parsed, which would enhance the usefulness of the user plugins that may parse ivy descriptors.

column1: Disable UI animation
column39:
As an Artifactory administrator
I want to disable UI animations in the Web UI
So that I can get my job done faster

*Background:*
We use Citrix on a virtualised HW without a dedicated graphic card, which results in any animations to turn into a few-seconds-slow slideshow. Waiting for animations in Artifactory to appear and disappear reduces our productivity and we would like to have an option to turn them on/off globally.

*Scenario - New UI setting*
Given I am logged in to Artifactory with an administrator role
When I navigate to Admin -> Configuration -> General Configuration
Then there is a checkbox option "Disable UI animation" in the "Look & Feel Settings" panel.

*Scenario - Default value*
Given I am logged in to Artifactory with an administrator role
When I navigate to Admin -> Configuration -> General Configuration
Then the checkbox option "Disable UI animation" is enabled by default

*Scenario - UI animations enabled*
Given I am logged in to Artifactory
And the UI animation settings are enabled
When I perform any action which uses animation (e.g. appearing/disappearing a "Deploy" popup")
Then the animation is played

*Scenario - UI animations disabled*
Given I am logged in to Artifactory
And the UI animation settings are disabled
When I perform any action which uses animation (e.g. appearing/disappearing a "Deploy" popup")
Then the animation is not played and the "animated " element is shown/hidden immediately

column1: Option to return 202 Accepted when a big sized data is being caches
column39:
When an artifact is being cached from a remote repository before distribution to the client, there should be the option to return 202 to that client according to the size of the artifact to be downloaded.
For instance, if I request a 2G file from artifactory that must be first downloaded from a remote repository. If the threshold is set at 500M in the remote repo config, artifactory do not keep the connection open until data is actually being delivered but immediately returns 202 to the client.

column1: GAVC search takes too long to respond when you leave Group ID empty or provide a wildcard
column39:
Edit:
Package search - Maven GAVC in UI without GroupId has a really bad performance. A search request, if you don’t know the GroupId (a common use case) lasts about 2 minutes. The same search via API lasts 8 seconds.

GAVC search in UI takes too long to respond when you leave Group ID empty or provide a wildcard.

When this field is left empty or just a wildcard is provided, the SQL query also uses a wildcard for the LIKE operator in the search query. When using only the wildcard for LIKE operator SQL does not use the indexes in the table and the search takes too long to respond.

We need to add a message in the UI when GAVC search is used. Something like this "Please do not leave the Group ID field empty and also don't provide only a wildcard, as this will cause the search to be slow"

column1: Adding a sharding instance to an HA cluster with no NFS
column39:
Suggesting the following:
*Adding cluster-sharding write strategies*
This has to be configured as crossNetwork, which is further working as roundRobin between the shards. Having the option for this to be crossNetwork, but also freeSpace based.

*Sharding under cluster-sharding*
*The scenario is described below.

Since Artifactory 5 there is the possibility to work without NFS to share the cluster's data.

We encountered the following scenario:
Had a standalone instance with a filesystem that has got full.
Then, were required to add an additional filesystem storage and configure sharding with the freeSpace strategy.

Afterwards, wanted to set up an HA cluster, with the above described being one of the nodes, and add an additional node to the cluster with a single filesystem storage.

In that case we wanted to configure  sharding under cluster-sharding, however this is not possible.
Moreover, even if the first instance had only 1 filesystem storage, we would like to configure a freeSpace write strategy, but it is not possible as the cluster-sharding has to be crossNetwork.

column1: map nuget tags from .nuspec as multi value nuget.tags properties
column39:
Currently Artifactory maps the <tags> from the .nuspec file as a single value nuget.tags property.
This should be mapped as a multi value property in order to allow searches by nuget tags.

column1: Event notification on RPM metadata change
column39:
This is to request notification improvement on RPM repos to allow watchers to get notifications when RMP metadata changes.

From our user request:
"I would really appreciate being able to setup an alert for when the RPM repo metadata was created by artifactory. I tried setting up a watcher on the repo metadata path but no notifications are sent, I assume since its a server update not someone pushing new files. Also if I delete the metadata tree which I do before updating the repos the event subscription also gets deleted."

column1: Display a tooltip massage regarding system export and import
column39:
1. Display a tooltip next to the system import section that explain that importing a system will not import configuration files such as the db.porpeorties/binarystore.xml/ha-node.propreties

2.  For export, display a tooltip message that explains that all of the Artifactory configuration/system files/encryption/access keys will exported as well.

column1: Allow for setting the length and charset of tokens
column39: The length of tokens exceeds what is allowed by apt-get. This means apt-get cannot use the tokens inside of a .list file.

column1: Larger Target Path input text box in artifact Copy/Move dialog
column39:
The input text box for artifact copy/move dialog is too small and hard to work with when the path is long. It would be very useful if you make the dialog wider and/or extend the text box as far right as the dialog's border.
See https://www.screencast.com/t/KuvFIvQVLv
Thanks.

column1: Documentation for custom PHP composer remote repositories is lacking
column39:
The documentation for *custom* composer settings in the following web page https://www.jfrog.com/confluence/display/RTF/PHP+Composer+Repositories  is non-existent. 

It is not clear how to connect to a remote repository and how the composer tool interacts with the parameters given. I have been trying to connect to the Drupal composer repositories via Artifactory beyond the standard PHP composer repository (See attached) 

Would love to see better documentation or even support for this situation of mirroring public PHP composer spaces.

column1: Manage Repository Permissions in Repository Tab
column39:
I would love to be able to select a specific repo, then enable and disable group and user permissions on it directly.

Example: I want to "hide" a repo by removing all read/write permissions on it. Currently, I have to go into each specific permission target and remove the repo. I also have to go into the users and groups and manage permissions on that repo there.

Artifactory already has a tab that displays effective permissions for a repo. That's the model I'd like to see used for the permission admin of that repo.

column1: provide better indication that a newly added redundant shard is in sync
column39: When adding another shard to the binarystore.xml and increasing redundancy accordingly (to make the new shard a copy of the other, we should provide a better indication that the 'Optimize System Storage' procedure completed successfully and that all files are synced to the new shard.

column1: Option to disable new Reference Panel
column39: As I am running this internal to my company, I would like to be able to either disable or redirect the links in the Reference Panel on the main webapp page.  Are there any options, either through the JVM or the configuration pages, that allow for this?

column1: Artifactory should warn/prevent artifact/directory names of over 234 characters
column39:
On export or back up, Artifactory add the string *'.artifactory-metadata'* to each artifact/directory.
When the name of that artifact/directory is nearly 255 characters, adding the above string (which is 21 characters) makes it go over 255 characters, and result in an error when trying to create this directory in the filesystem.

+To reproduce+:
1. Deploy something to Artifactory and use a Target Path name of *235 characters*, for example: LoremipsumdolorsitametconsecteturadipiscingelitSedegestasodioegetlacusconsecteturdignissimDonecmattisaliquetturpisnonimperdietorcimollisvelUteterosurnaFuscevitaetinciduntloremPraesentultricesloremaarcutinciduntaliquamCurabiturpellentes/
2. Then, try to export the repository that contain this directory

+Result+:
The export process fails to create a directory named LoremipsumdolorsitametconsecteturadipiscingelitSedegestasodioegetlacusconsecteturdignissimDonecmattisaliquetturpisnonimperdietorcimollisvelUteterosurnaFuscevitaetinciduntloremPraesentultricesloremaarcutinciduntaliquamCurabiturpellentes.artifactory-metadata, which is 256 characters
* An error prompts:
 !Screen_Shot_2017-05-23_at_16_10_49.png|thumbnail! 
* artifactory.log shows:
 !Screen_Shot_2017-05-23_at_16_11_13.png|thumbnail! 

As this is an OS limitation, Artifactory should at least warn users when using names of over 234 (255-21) characters.

column1: Add a snippet generator for IIS rewrite rule
column39:
User on Microsoft Windows Server may want to use IIS for url rewrite in order to integrate with docker instead of using Nginx or Apache asa reverse proxy.

This can be done with "IIS url rewrite" module available see : https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/iis/extensions/url-rewrite-module/creating-rewrite-rules-for-the-url-rewrite-module

It would be great to provide it in snippet generator or at list to document it on our wiki

column1: Allow variables in permission include/exclude patterns, such as username
column39:
In the permissions section, it would be useful to have a way of using variables in the include pattern, such as username.

This would allow you to setup permissions for certain repos such as npm/docker to allow users to read and write to their own namespace by using the pattern `/$username/*` without having to manually set it up for every user

column1: System info should display information regarding the database.
column39:
System Info should show information on the configuration of the advanced parameters on the database side.
Parameters such as
pool.max.active
pool.max.idle
on the db.properties file are currently not displayed anywhere.

column1: Search Within Virtual Repositories
column39:
The Search feature currently will include results from *-cache repositories.  This is source of confusion for users as they will pin scripts and deployments to a URL that is returned from the search results.  If the cache is deleted, then the URL may no longer work, and the scripts will fail.

We would prefer a way to limit searches to Virtual, or possibly Remote repositories.  This way when a user finds a URL in the search results, it is less likely that the link will be become invalid due to flushed caches.

column1: Support multiple LDAP URLs
column39:
Hello,

Java LDAP JNDI supports multiple URLs in provider field.

The artifactory UI does not permit specify more than one URL.

If you use Java JNDI it should be trivial to enable multiple URLs to provide redundancy.

Thanks!

column1: Support startTLS for LDAP
column39:
Hi,

startTLS is a standard method to communicate with LDAP, easier to use in many environment.
Support should be fairly trivial, see[1].
Can you please consider to support?

Example[2], using srv record derives ldap, makes only starttls possible.

"""
For example, given a URL of ldap:///dc=example,dc=com, the service provider will try to locate the DNS SRV records for _ldap._tcp.example.com. If the provider finds such records, it will then extract and use the hostnames and ports of the LDAP servers from the records. The order in which it uses these records follows the algorithm described in the Internet draft draft-ietf-ldapext-locate-08.txt.
"""

Thanks!

[1] https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/javax/naming/ldap/StartTlsResponse.html
[2] http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/jndi/jndi-ldap.html

column1: Allow users to pin repos at top of UI repo browser
column39: With our ever increasing number of repos, we find the repo browser to be cumbersome. This is especially true for a number of our users who regularly view the artifact properties only available under local repos. As an enhancement request, we'd like users to be able to pin repos at the top, much like pinning the trash can at the bottom.

column1: Indexing archived Docker images
column39:
Make Docker repositories support .tar/.tar.gz docker images, created by the docker save command.

In Docker you can compress your image into a ".tar"/".tar.gz" file by running "docker save -o IMAGE".
https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/save/

Later this image can be loaded, also in a new environment by running "docker load -i IMAGE.tar".
https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/load/#parent-command
column252: 17/May/17 2:14 PM;alexbrazier;I have created a very basic tool https://github.com/alexbrazier/docker-upload that allows users to import docker images into artifactory using a web interface, without having to manually go through the process of transferring it to a docker machine, importing it, retagging it, and pushing to artifactory

column1: Maven Set Me Up shouldn't use the machine hostname for the "<name>" tag of the repository on HA
column39:
The Maven Set Me Up (distributionManagement section) produces an inconsistent behaviour in HA as it uses the hostname of the node as the "repository" name (see attached image, the name is the hostname of the docker container hosting the server).
This of course is unique to every node. We should use a value that is consistent across different nodes in the cluster as this is confusing for users.

column1: Backup alerting
column39:
Hi

Could you change the email alerts so that "Not enough free space to perform backup backup-daily" would fire an email to the admins rather than just log something to the log file.

thanks

column1: Artifactory sort NuGet packages alphabetically and not by relevance
column39:
To reproduce:
- Open Nuget Package Manager in Visual Studio
- Select *"nuget.org"* as the Package Source
- Browse for *xunit*
 !Screen_Shot_2017-04-24_at_11_24_05.png|thumbnail! 
- The packages are sorted by +relevance+. Most of the time the most downloaded at top (for example xunit,5.63M download is +first+)
- Change the Package Source to *"Artifactory"* (after configuring it to work against the virtual/remote Nuget repository)
- Browse for *xunit* again
 !Screen_Shot_2017-04-24_at_11_23_17.png|thumbnail! 
- The packages are sorted +alphabetically+. (The original xunit package is only 15th on the list)

It makes it harder for developers to search the desired package when using Artifactory.
column252:
06/Apr/20 9:58 AM;haraldsh;This is true for Visual Studio 2019 as well
We've recently converted from ProGet and we find it odd that this feature isn't implemented. I had a developer who was quite bewildered that he couldn't find SwashBuckler for Asp.Net Core.
Search on package names usually put the package on top in the result, but now in worst case, it's the last result in the list.

column1: Add a unique correlating ID to request.log/artifactory.log entries
column39:
When analyzing logs, we need a definitive, correlating element between a request.log entry and an artifactory.log entry. For example, adding the thread-id on the request.log might help, but won't be as definitive as adding a unique identifier to both the request.log and artifactory.log because thread-ids get re-used.

If this calculation adds considerable overhead when bound to every HTTP thread, we should consider making this a configurable option (disabled by default) that Support can advise customers to enable, but if we can find a cheap solution it will be best to enable it by default. 

An example use case would be a deploy request that triggers events such as replication or archive indexing, for example. The corresponding PUT request on the request.log should have an ID that will also be added to every subsequent artifactory.log entries that will be triggered following the PUT request.
column252: 08/Aug/19 3:10 PM;andreik;For thread ID to show up in the request.log (correlated with the thread in artifactory.log) --> add [%thread] to the <pattern> attribute of the REQUEST appender

column1: Artifactory prohibits include/exclude patterns with spaces
column39:
Artifactory doesn't except include/exclude patterns which has spaces in it.
The space is trimmed
So for example, the following pattern "**/a a" will be converted to
"**/aa"

02/May/19 3:52 PM;cynthiadevaraj;Any ETA for this issue. this is impacting our users

 

Thanks,

Cynthia

column1: Trigger maven metadata calculation for the repository after restoring deleted artifacts from the trash can
column39: Trigger maven metadata calculation for the repository after restoring deleted artifacts from the trash can. Currently you have to run the calculate maven metadata REST API in order to generate the maven-metadata.xml files.

column1: Encryption of data in transit
column39: currently the data in transit is not encrypted. Please provide with encrypting data in transit

column1: Choice of subdomain wildcard in reverse proxy docker config
column39:
In my environment I have a base Artifactory URL of

_https://art.repo.example.com/artifactory_

And my cert has a SAN that includes _*.repo.example.com_ (specifically for Docker). In the reverse proxy config I have set Docker to use subdomain, but the expression is hard coded to _*.art.repo.example.com_, which is then displayed in the _Set me up_ inline help and users send support requests when it doesn't work.

I propose a comobox choice for the subdomain expression: *.<base url> or *.<base url without the hostname>. 

For Apache HTTPD the following rewrite rule works in my case

_RewriteCond "%{HTTP_HOST}" "^((?!art).*)\.repo.example.com$"_

I concede this is not 100% correct expression as it would leave artfoo.repo.example.com unmodified, but we simply have convention that all docker repos start with "docker" .
column252:
13/Apr/17 1:06 PM;jgeorgeson;I received a request in the support channel to clarify the proposed feature. 

I don't want to configure multiple subdomain wildcard rules in httpd.conf. I want the Artifactory reverse proxy config generator UI to have a combobox to select one of two subdomain expressions. One choice puts the wildcard as a subdomain of the server's FQDN (current behavior, *.art.repo.example.com), the other choice puts the wildcard in place of the host in the FQDN (new choice not currently offered, *.repo.example.com). The generated httpd.conf file, and all Docker repo _Set me up_ pages, consistently use the one selected subdomain expression.

column1: Repository creation date and creator info in UI
column39: Repository creation date and creator info in UI. It will be nice to display this info as part of a repository as it helps to know when it was created and who created it.  Since we have repositories which are quite old, and sometimes we need to know when and who created it.  With the logs its really for short time and is not handy.
column252: 13/Jun/19 2:15 PM;jbirney;To add to this request...it would be awesome if we could also get an repo owner listed too. This way you can find out who is the owner in case you have permissions request to that repo, have to do a review with the owner on the permissions settings, etc.

column1: Cocoapods - repo art update command with anonymous doesn't fetch metadata
column39:
Artifactory 5.1.3
cocoapods (1.2.0)
cocoapods-art 1.0.0
The local cocoapods repo has been added on the client.
When running the following command
pod repo-art update <repo>, a request is sent to Artifactory to fetch the metadata:
..|anonymous|GET|/api/pods/podim/index/fetchIndex|HTTP/1.1|200|0
For anonymous that doesn't have enough permissions to download folders, the result will still be 200 without getting the metadata.
The error will be on the client side and is unclear.

column1: Artifactory should return a clear error message when deploying to a non existing resource
RepositoryConfiguration does not include isEnableYum method
column39: In the RepositoryConfiguration there is no isEnableYum. We should introduce the isEnableYum also to get if this is Yum repository

column1: A more flexible artifactory access log format
column39:
"As a System Administrator I need to be able to adapt log layout so that external log analysis tools can automatically pick up events from Artifactory"

To be more specific I want to be able to adapt the access.log for IBM QRadar LEEF 1.0 (https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SS42VS_7.2.7/com.ibm.dsm.doc/c_LEEF_Format_Guide_intro.html) format.
column252:
13/Mar/17 12:29 PM;fprilmeier;A possible way of implementation would be to exploit LogBack MDC
https://logback.qos.ch/manual/mdc.html

I have made a local experiment based on the Artifactory 4.16.0 source code, changing the class org.artifactory.security.AccessLogger to populate MDC.

I could then easily pick up the fields using logback.xml with this pattern (now logging in LEEF compatible format) in the ACCESS appender:

<pattern>LEEF|1.0|JFrog|Artifactory|4.16.0|cat=info	devTime	=%date	action=%X{action}</pattern>

And Artifactory indeed logged within access.log:
LEEF|1.0|JFrog|Artifactory|4.16.2|cat=info      devTime =2017-02-18 11:04:49,514        action=LOGIN
column254: 13/Mar/17 12:55 PM;fprilmeier;I am pretty sure my proposed solution is an oversimplification (e.g. MDC and threads may not work well together).

column1: Provide .npmrc encoded password to filtered resources
column39:
Using filtered resources, it is possible to create personalized settings.xml files for users.

The same is unfortunately not possible for generating the .npmrc - the password in .npmrc is base64 encoded.

Please add the base64 encoded password to the security property.

column1: Show DN of a group in UI instead of just the name of the group
column39:
In Artifactory UI, it is difficult to know where each ldap group come from by looking at following UI pages:

* Artifactory => Admin => Edit LDAP Group Setting => Synchronize LDAP Groups
* Artifactory => Admin => Groups

It is because it just displays the group's name. Please consider showing DN of each group on the UIs above, just like how it is recorded in Security Descriptor as below:

    <group>
      <groupName>support-team-group</groupName>
      <newUserDefault>false</newUserDefault>
      <realm>ldap</realm>
      <realmAttributes>ldapGroupName=support-team-group;groupsStrategy=STATIC;*groupDn=cn=support-team-group,ou=groups,dc=joshua,dc=example,dc=com*</realmAttributes>
    </group>

column1: Support the possibility to perform dry run for copy/move operations within user plugin
column39: Currently from the UI and REST API the copy/move operations can be done with the dry run parameter. There is no such possability from within user plugins. We should add a support for the possibility to perform dry run for copy/move operations within user plugin

column1: bower should support tags of the form '<branch>/x.y.x'
column39:
public bower supports tags of the form <branch>/x.y.x, but artifactory does not support this.
Running "bower install ckeditor#basic/4.6.2" does not work against artifactory's remote bower repository, but works against the public bower registry.

column1: Build promotion does not handle different artifacts in different type repositories
column39:
Json spec allows to publish build artifacts to different target repositories and repository types, but build promotion does not handle such a scenario and promotion fails with {code}ERROR: Promotion failed during dry run (no change in Artifactory was done): HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request{code}

If it is possible to publish build artefacts this way, it should be possible to work with them afterwards.
column252: 15/Feb/17 5:33 PM;eyalb;I'm moving this issue to the Artifactory Binary Repository (RTFACT) Jira project.
column253: 19/Jul/17 11:03 AM;markg;Important to note that you can work around this by promoting multiple times and setting failFast to false (i.e. promote from mg-mvn-stage-local to mg-mvn-release-local as source and target repo, and then for another promotion action promote source mg-rpm-stage-local to mg-rpm-release-local to promote both maven artifacts and rpms created by the same jenkins pipeline.)  while you will get error messages, they can be safely ignored, and the promotions will happen successfully.

column255: 13/Aug/19 6:00 AM;Ricardf;No news on that?

08/May/20 10:06 AM;olivier.vanekem;I think this is needed indeed. I have a single Jenkins pipeline producing Java and Docker artefacts and pushing those to different repositories. Because of this I cannot promote the build with with a single action, and even with multiple actions, it generates error in the build promotion which is not very clean.

Another workaround is to declare different build pipelines (one per technology) but again, this is not user friendly and clean because then you still need to do different build promotions on different pipelines while you promote in fact a single version of a product.

column1: Improving the UI for push replication configuraiton
column39:
Currently the cron job field is on top.
Beneath it there is the check box for the event push replication.
This can be confusing to users.
When enabling the event push replication, cron job become minor (only for backup).
No need to do it quite often.

Thus, need to replace the structure so event push will be on top and cron job will be second.
Another nice improvement will be a message to the user that when event push is on, no need for an extensive cron job.

column1: Remove layout configuration option under Virtual repository
column39: Please remove layout configuration option under Virtual repository since it is not used.

column1: Move /opt/jfrog/artifactory/tomcat/tmp to /var
column39:
As a user, I run a fairly standard install of Artifactory as a debian package. In this set-up, Tomcat is linked from /var/opt/jfrog/artifactory/tomcat to /opt/jfrog/artifactory/tomcat.

Using a standard install for a single service server, I kept /opt fairly small (6gb). This should be fine for installation and upgrade of Artifactory. As we're testing, a user attempted to upload a large .tar.gz file via the UI (1.6gb). this failed due to file size limitations in the UI. I advised to upload using curl and the API. This also failed.

Checking, I saw that /opt was full. Further analysis showed MIMEXXX.txt files in /opt/jfrog/artifactory/tomcat/temp. These appear to be created during transactions. These appear to clean-up automatically, however, when the disk becomes full, clean-up does not occur.

I propose Artifactory use a more standard Linux install set-up. large transient files should be kept in /var or /tmp. This will protect users from large transaction files filling /opt

Also, I would suggest documenting this in the meantime. I have used a workaround of creating a symlink from /opt/jfrog/artifactory/tomcat/temp -> /var/opt/jfrog/artifactory/tmp/tomcat/. This functions well, but adds an extra step to installation.
column40: Ubuntu 14.04, Apache2 webserver, using reverse proxy. Artifactory installed as debian package.

column1: Add an f5 snippet to the reverse proxy settings generator and the Wiki
Deploying from the UI a jar with multiple poms in the META-INF/maven folder randomly selects one pom to collect maven coordinates
column39:
Steps to reproduce:
Bundle an uber JAR file with multiple modules
Deploy it from the UI
See that it's maven coordinates are selected randomly from one of the modules in it's META-INF/maven folder.

column1: Use %{my_custom_host}e instead of the "Public Server Name" field in the X-Artifactory-Override-Base-Url header for Apache configs
column39:
We currently use the "Public Server Name" field as the value of the hostname inside the X-Artifactory-Override-Base-Url header. We should use the %{my_custom_host}e notation to use the variable that we are capturing with the corresponding RewriteRule instead, i.e:

RequestHeader set X-Artifactory-Override-Base-Url %{my_scheme}e://%{my_custom_host}e:8080/artifactory

This is inline with the $host variable that is used in the Nginx configuration:

$http_x_forwarded_proto://$host:$server_port/artifactory;

column1: Allow remote repo option "offline mode" to be set by non-admin users
column39: We have a use case where Artifactory users are creating custom snapshots of remote repos.  They will populate the local Artifactory cache with the packages they want then freeze it by setting the repo to "offline mode".  It would be helpful to allow the remote repo "offline mode" option to be set by non-admin users.  This could be done similar to how the recalculate index feature was granted to non-admin users.

column1: Notifications about events
column39:
Hello,

We would like to receive notifications about certain events in Artifactory, just like you would in JIRA.

For example, we would like to get an email when somebody has downloaded/uploaded some artifact or changed a specific folder in the given repository. 

We think that it should be configurable in the GUI.

column1: Support for nested archives
column39:
In artifactory UI it is possible to expand archives and view text files located inside. For Java artifacts it is common to have nested archives, e.g. an EAR containing WARs containing JARs. 

Would be great if those could be expandend and text files viewed as well.

column1: Add AQL support for current status based results
column39:
Add support for AQL for retrieval of results that are status based

E.g.:

build.find({"promotion.currentStatus" : {"$match":"Released"}})

column1: Need a direct link to a file inside an archive (.zip/.tar.gz)
column39: Currently, I can download a file inside an archive (.zip/.tar.gz) using the download link.  However I can't view that same file inside the tree browser.  It would be nice to have a link that I can pass on to other users or linked by other applications to view the file inside the Artifactory tree browser with the view source property tab selected.

column1: Support isMemberOf for LDAP Group
column39:
Instead of using Static group option in Artifactory's LDAP, also provide an option to use the isMemberOf attribute for static groups. 

(The isMemberOf attribute is calculated and added to the user entry at the start of the search. It is then removed again after the search has finished. This functionality provides easy management of groups, and fast read access.https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E19424-01/820-4809/bcajp/index.html)

column1: Update Debian Release File
column39:
There's a typo/bug in the "Release" file. The line "Component: main" should instead read "Components: main"

The problem is the pluralization of "Components". The proposed fix:

# diff -u Release.broken Release.fixed
--- Release.broken 2017-01-09 13:22:34.000000000 -0500
+++ Release.fixed 2017-01-09 13:23:00.000000000 -0500
@@ -3,7 +3,7 @@
Suite: trusty
Codename: trusty
Date: Tue, 13 Dec 2016 15:27:27 UTC
-Component: main
+Components: main
Architectures: amd64 i386
MD5Sum:
362be9fdb8e5ee4faae9c8795d4c51f3 38420 main/binary-all/Packages

"Release" file where the problem was spotted:
https://jfrog.bintray.com/artifactory-debs/dists/trusty/Release

The Debian documentation describing the file:
https://wiki.debian.org/RepositoryFormat#Components

The (outdated) Debian documentation describing the original, singular component parameter:
https://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/repository-howto/repository-howto#release

column1: Set Me Up on NuGet repository should use feed name
column39:
When clicking on "Set me up" on a NuGet-Repository, the following command structure is offered to add the feed to the list of known nuget feeds on the client

??nuget sources Add -Name Artifactory -Source <Path to feed>??

Since many feeds can be hosted on Artifactory, it would be helpful if the name would not be set to "Artifactory" be default but rather to the name of the feed itself.

column1: Once deleting a plugin from the plugins directory the REST API for reloading should remove this plugin from the memory
column39:
Currently when you remove a plugin from the plugins directory and run the REST API for reloading you will see an exception for the missing groovy file:

Error loading script from '/path/to/plugin.groovy’. groovy.util.ResourceException: Cannot open URL…

The same if you configure the refresh time of the plugin. Currently to delete a plugin you will need a full restart of the Artifactory server. 

Artifactory should remove the plugins that are missing from the in memory.
column252: 27/Dec/16 4:37 PM;dbreen;In environments like ours where restarts are often tightly controlled, having this feature would be very useful.

column1: Max Unique tags configuration on docker repositories should trigger cleanup process
column39:
Currently only create (push of an image), move or copy trigger a cleanup process for the max unique tags limit.
Any re-configuration of this value (as of the first time you configure a value) should trigger this process as well.
column252: 28/Dec/16 7:18 AM;asahu;This improvement should come as an add-on feature, there should be option to chose different kind of docker image cleanup policy.
column253:
13/Jan/20 7:19 AM;alitou;After more than 3 years of creating this issue, I think this is a BUG in Artifactory that changing max unique tags in configurations doesn't trigger cleanup.

My case is I have more than 60 Docker services with each having production and development builds, and each one having multiple tags (e.g. docker.myregistry.com/svc1/development:tag1). Recently I faced with the issue that I was keeping too much unique tags and I ran out of disk space. So I changed it to a lower count and I expected Artifactory to start deleting the oldest tags. As it doesn't I must delete my 5 oldest tags manually (about 60*2*5 times of right-click, delete, yes), or I must wait for a deploy to trigger the cleanup. But I can't deploy, as I don't have any disk space left.
column254:
28/Jan/20 10:09 AM;erezinchy;Hi,

yes, would be good to have such feature. It makes sense that if you reduce the number of unique tags, it should kick of the cleanup process.

thanks,
Erez.

column1: Maven plugin metadata calculation should print the full path and name of corrupted POM files
column39:
Calculation of Maven Plugins metadata should print the full path of corrupted POM files if there are any. Right now there's no easy way to know which file is causing the repetitive errors on the log if there's a corrupt maven plugin POM file in the repo. 

To reproduce:

1.Upload some dummy file to a maven repo (not a valid pom), but under a valid maven path, with the artifactory.maven.mavenPlugin=true prop:
curl -T foo.bar -uadmin:password "http://localhost:8080/artifactory/libs-release-local/com/uriahl/artifact/1.0/artifact-1.0.bla;artifactory.maven.mavenPlugin=true"

2.Invoke maven calculation:
curl -XPOST -uadmin:password "http://localhost:8080/artifactory/api/maven/calculateMetadata/libs-release-local"

The log should print an error that says "Failed to convert string to maven model", but the path of the corrupt file will not be printed. This is a problem with repos that have a large amount of plugin POM files, since you can't tell which ones are corrupt and are producing the errors during metadata calc.

column1: Add global options for enabling internal password for external realms
column39:
Currently, an LDAP user (as an example) will have its *internal password disabled by default*.  

However, in the case this would need to be enabled globally (for all users) - it would be better to have a global option to enable this behavior.

column1: Automatically Upgrade Salve Nodes in Cluster
column39: This improvement is to request that when upgrading an HA cluster, that once the master node is upgraded that each remaining slave node in the cluster get automatically upgraded (one at a time).  This would reduce the maintenance effort where the upgrade process is done "manually" once on the master and then automatically propagated to all other nodes in the cluster w/o any intervention (this is quite useful for large deployment)

column1: Use SSH pub key in order to allow access to Docker registry
column39:
This is pretty much a clone of https://github.com/docker/docker-registry/issues/531

Is there a way for Artifactory to support this? Hopefully implemented in a manner similar to Atlassian's Bitbucket Server (https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/enabling-ssh-access-to-git-repositories-in-bitbucket-server-776640358.html)

column1: Improve logging for mail server setup in Artifactory
column39:
Currently when Artifactory fails to send an email to a test recipient during the mail server configuration, the logs show the below message which does not indicate the cause of the failure. We need to show the response or error in the artifactory.log that is received from the SMTP server when it fails to send the test email.

We see this message when we try the mail server configuration setup with gmail smtp server and Amazon SES SMTP that fail to send the test email.

2016-12-05 10:53:10,626 [http-nio-8081-exec-9] [ERROR] (o.a.u.r.s.a.c.m.TestMailService:120) - An error occurred while sending e-mail. See logs for additional information
org.artifactory.util.EmailException: An error occurred while sending e-mail. See logs for additional information

column1: Docker repository path
column39: I use Artfictory Cloud (plumbr.jfrog.io) and I have a docker repository named 'dockerv2-local'. Artifcatory UI shows me "Repository Path:	dockerv2-local/". But as far as Docker goes this is absolutely of no use to me. I want to see the full path that I can use to comminicate with the Docker, which is "plumbr-dockerv2-local.jfrog.io"

column1: Update TeamCity Logo
column39:
Since TeamCity v9, the logo has changed. cf. https://teamcity.jetbrains.com

An update on home could be great.

column1: Support multiple login ID with LDAP
column39:
We have a couple of unique attributes which can be "ID" in our LDAP's user object. So people could be confused what is "ID" when they faced to log in. If we can log in artifactory with several ID, people don't need to think about it.

For example, I want to log in with my Employee ID or with my email address.
I found that I can make people log in with multiple ID with LDAP "search filter" like below.

{code:none}
search filter :  (|(cn={0})(extensionAttribute14={0}))
{code}


But there is a problem that the artifactory identifies this user as two users, one by their common name and another by the email. If an admin can set multiple attributes as "User name" in the LDAP configuration page, it could be much nicer.

column1: Artifactory should either support passphrase protected server-level SSH keys, or prevent users from uploading them
column39:
We don't support server-level encrypted RSA keys (Admin -> Security -> SSH server). We should either support them (which I'm not sure is really neccesary, considering that the private key is only accessed by the Artifactory server itself), or, as an interim solution, not allow saving such keys via the UI. An encrypted RSA key can be identified easily as they include two additional fields that non-encrypted ones don't. 

an encrypted key will start like this: 

-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY----- 
*Proc-Type: 4,ENCRYPTED* 
*DEK-Info: AES-128-CBC,D54228DB5838E32589695E83A22595C7*

A non-encrypted key will start like this: 

-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY----- 
MIIEogIBAAKCAQEArCQG213utzqE5YVjTVF5exGRCkE9OuM7LCp/FOuPdoHrFUXk
...... 
-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----

column1: Storage Summary should better calculate total free storage in case of sharding
column39:
Check the attached screenshot.
In case of redundancy > 1 the total free space is not calculated properly.
Need to take under consideration the following:
- different filestores or not 
- redundency

In addition, RTFACT-12519 which relate to the cache-fs details

column1: 'Repository Configuration' REST api returns 400 on a non-existing repository
Failure of event propagations in HA should be registered and reflected in the UI
column39:
Propagation of events in HA is being done via REST API requests between the nodes in the cluster. Such requests may intermittently fail, and are completely detached from the heartbeat job mechanism which is the main cluster health indicator in the UI - the heartbeat is done via the database, while event propagation is done via HTTP and as such subject to a different set of problems. 

Some of these failures can be critical for operation, for example a failing configuration change propagation will cause configuration inconsistency over the cluster. 

Our UI should be able to display a history of those failures in the High Availability screen to indicate  that the "cluster health" is affected by them.

column1: Import LDAP users
column39:
Currently, in order to register LDAP users in Artifactory, an initial login by an LDAP user is required for its creation in Artifactory. 

* This can be 'workaround'ed' by invoking an authentication-required REST API call with the LDAP user's credentials that will create a user as well. 

Having an option to import LDAP users without an initial can be useful for manipulating and performing user related actions without having an initial login to occur.
column252:
15/May/17 10:00 PM;donald.faul;In truth, rather than having the ability to re-import the LDAP group, it would be less headache for adminstrators to have Artifactory automatically re-synch the LDAP group periodically (hourly, daily) to:

a) add new users from the directory group
b) remove users no longer in the directory group
c) re-synch email and other attributes from the directory group.
column253: 31/Jan/19 4:02 PM;sander.bel;The 'initial login' for a new LDAP user creates quite some overhead for us, a solution would be much appreciated!
column254:
05/Jul/19 9:50 PM;pbusque;The lack if "import" feature is also a hassle for us.

A team leader want to have his team access Artifactory / X-Ray.

I have to :

1- Contact every single person, asking them to long in.

2- Once they have done it (hopefully, none are in vacations), I go back into Artifactory and set the proper permission.

 

Or worse, I have a new employ that will require access. The account is already created in LDAP, but I have to wait for the user to come and log in before setting him up.

 

I should have the option to simply "import" a user into Artifactory using only the username.

18/Feb/20 11:20 AM;momcilo.majic@elektrobit.com;Hi All,

To my best knowledge: it is possible to create account by posting:

{

  "name": "some_name",
  "internalPasswordDisabled": "true",

Mail has to match the mail of the ldap record. Such user is created as internal user. Provided that instance is connected to LDAP, once the user logs in it will be converted to ldap realm.

column1: To have the ability to do GAVC search against JCenter repository
column39: To have the ability to do GAVC search against JCenter repository

column1: LDAP Group search by group name
column39:
It could more initiative to investigate and if possible to allow a search based on a specific group name 

Also, for organizations with a large number of LDAP groups, searching for a specific user that members these groups could yield a very large result list, making it harder to find that specific LDAP group an Artifactory admin is after.

Adding a Group name based search could prove to be more effective than the existing User/wildcard-based search for such use cases.

column1: Permissions based on virtual repository
column39: A lot of customers have asked to provide permissions based on virtual repository. For large corporations and enterprises it becomes messier to maintain permissions on all repositories. So they want to be able to assign permissions based on virtual repo. Hide local/remote repos if users tries to access it directly. So that way they can force the usage of virtual repo.

column1: LDAP-side disabled user shows as 'Active' on Artifactory
column39:
Disabling a user on LDAP side and then checking his 'Active' status will still return 'Active' (contrary to removing a user altogether or moving him outside of the search base a user). 

* This applies to 'Internally created users'.

column1: Add backups size under the 'Storage' menu
column39: Displayed storage size for configured Artifactory backups, can help to better understand the space used for each backup.

column1: Enable user plugin storage execution points for the trash can
column39: We utilize custom logic within a user plugin to periodically delete old or un-used artifacts from our local repositories.  Upon deletion, these artifacts move into the trash can.  We need the ability to know and take action when (before/after) Artifactory permanently deletes these artifacts from the trash can.  This would allow us to trigger the removal of related information from other applications and databases that reference the deleted items.
column252:
13/Oct/16 3:46 PM;david.breitzmann;To clarify this request, consider the following sequence of events.

1.  Jenkins job A build number 27 creates one artifact named mylibrary.jar and publishes it to libs-release-local:the/path/to/mylibrary.jar.

2.  In the future, someone (or some automated process) deletes libs-release-local:the/path/to/mylibrary.jar.

3.  Two weeks later (by default), Artifactory permanently deletes libs-release-local:the/path/to/mylibrary.jar from the trash can.

At this point, I would like Artifactory to trigger plugin code to respond to the deletion of libs-release-local:the/path/to/mylibrary.jar from the trash can.  If the deletion of mylibrary.jar leaves no artifacts for build #27 of job A in Artifactory, then the plugin can delete that build from Jenkins.

column1: Make storage API support remote repos
column39:
We are trying to use the storage REST API to get a list of all artifacts in a directory of a virtual repo. Unfortunately, part of the virtual repo is a remote repo and the storage API only lists what is in the local cache for the remote repo.

The browse UI will show what is in the remote system but not yet cached with the ">" character. The storage API should match the output of the browse UI and preferably indicate what is not yet cached through an attribute.
column252: 08/Aug/19 5:21 PM;mike-j;Is this being considered at all?  Our organization has had to work around this for the past few years by manually querying all of our geo-specific instances.
column253:
30/Oct/19 2:14 PM;benedicte.garcia;Hello,

We have the same need here.

Best regards.

column1: Prevent login to Artifactory if user is not a member of any Artifactory group and no group has auto-join set
column39:
We have Artifactory Pro 4.9.0 version installed. The question is reguarding to  "Prevent login to Artifactory if user is not a member of any Artifactory group and no group has auto-join set". I didn't select any component  to create this JIRA ticket, so please forward to the right component team. 

Currently, if a valid LDAP user with the proper password login to Artifactory but is not a member of any Artifactory group, the login will succeed but the user will be unable to see or do anything. We would prefer that only authorized users (that have a role/permissions inside Artifactory) be able to login to it. Is there a way to do this?

column1: /api/storageinfo doesn't return the "fileStoreSummary" section if sharding is used
column39:
To reproduce - 

1.Use a simple sharding binarystore.xml:

<config version="4">
    <chain>
            <provider id="sharding" type="sharding">
                <redundancy>1</redundancy>
                <readBehavior>roundRobin</readBehavior>
                <writeBehavior>percentageFreeSpace</writeBehavior>
                <sub-provider id="shard-fs-1" type="state-aware"/>
                <sub-provider id="shard-fs-2" type="state-aware"/>
            </provider>
    </chain>

    <provider id="shard-fs-1" type="state-aware">
        <fileStoreDir>/Users/uriah/filestore1</fileStoreDir>
    </provider>
    
    <provider id="shard-fs-2" type="state-aware">
        <fileStoreDir>/Users/uriah/filestore2</fileStoreDir>
    </provider>  
</config>

2.curl -uadmin:password http://localhost:8080/artifactory/api/storageinfo

Note that the fileStoreSummary section shows this:
"fileStoreSummary": {
        "freeSpace": "0 bytes (N/A)",
        "storageDirectory": "Filesystem storage is not used",
        "storageType": "filesystem",
        "totalSpace": "0 bytes",
        "usedSpace": "0 bytes (N/A)"
    },

column1: Admin -> Storage should indicate better when one of the shards is deactivated
column39: When one of the shards is down, Artifactory shows "NaN undefined" if you click on it in the Storage page. There should be a better indication (i.e Artifactory should state the shard is "deactivated" and maybe also paint it in red) which would make it easier to know when a shard is inaccessible. The UI should also indicate a deactivation of a shard due to a lack of disk space.

column1: Allow virtual repositories for GAVC search
column39: GAVC search with virtual repositories on the rest call parameters return empty results.

column1: VirtualHost wildcard improvment in Apache 'Reverse Proxy Configuration Generator'
column39:
Hi, 

If the _Docker Reverse Proxy Settings is_ *Port* (only, _Sub Domain_ not concerned by this part) : a definition like that could be better:
{code}
<VirtualHost realUrlSameAsServerName:thePort>
{code}

In addition, this configuration could be useless : 
{code}
ServerAlias *.url 
{code}

When Apache is used for other jobs than Artifactory, using VirtualHost wildcard could have impacts.

I can't explain why (root cause not found), but when I add some other VirtualHost in the configuration (like this one, real use case), I can't login on Artifactory when VirtualHost is wildcard.

{code}
# Old repository URL redirection
<VirtualHost old-repo.company.com:80>

  ServerName old-repo.company.com
  ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/old_repo_error.log
  CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/old_repo.log common

  # Maven Client usage  
  ProxyPreserveHost on
  ProxyPassMatch "^/repository/(virtual|proxied-releases)(.*)$" "ajp://localhost:8019/artifactory/maven-virtual$2"
  ProxyPassMatch "^/repository/(company-releases|company-snapshots)(.*)$" "ajp://localhost:8019/artifactory/maven-$1$2"
  ProxyPassMatch "^/repository/(extra-libs|commercial-libs)(.*)$" "ajp://localhost:8019/artifactory/maven-psa-extra-libs$2"

  # Human usage
  ProxyPassMatch "^(.*)$" "ajp://localhost:8019/artifactory$1"
 
</VirtualHost>
{code}

Best regards.

column1: Allow remote generic repository cache to replace previous version artifact
column39:
When a remote generic repository to another Artifactory instances requests a resource that is in the cache but whose remote source is newer, it should download the newer *artifact* and remove the previous one. 

Today we offer to expire the cache for non-generic and then check for newer metadata based on defined time - however, artifacts in generic repos will not be deleted and replaced by a newer version - which this feature request is about.
column252: 27/Sep/16 1:42 AM;arturoa;At the moment this can be accomplished with a user plugin but it would be nicer if it were supported natively.

column1: AQL - "version" search field with support for "latest" (integration/snapshot/release, etc)
Update permission target REST api should be additive
column39:
Currently, when running the update permission target REST api, it overrides existing permission target with the new config that is submitted.
This should be made additive so that you are able only to submit the users and permissions you wish to add to the permission target.

column1: allow ping access anonymous in Artifactory Docker Images.
column39:
When you start Artifactory docker container using DC/OS or kubernetes and disable  anonymous
from Artifactory UI it fails health check as  ping access to anonymous is disable by default.

We should add it in artifactory.system.properties of base Artifactory Docker image.

column1: Download user plugins should be activated upon directory requests
column39:
Allow the download plugin points to respond to directory requests.

At the moment the altResponse and beforeDownloadRequest will not listen to requests for directories such as:

localhost:8081/artifactory/my-repo/mydir/

It would be useful to be able to capture these requests and return alternative content.

10/Oct/16 10:29 AM;dimitar.sakarov;We have already two outstanding use cases that are waiting for this issue to be resolved.

Can we at least get an ETA for this, in order to know how to plan our work in regards?

Thanks!

column1: extra multibyte character on storage summary screen
column39:
I just upgraded to 4.12.0 and went to look at the Storage Summary screen (Admin -> Storage). I noticed an extra character after the 'Artifacts Size' header. I am not sure if this is new to 4.12.0 or if it's been there for a few versions.

The character is a '썘' and looks like it's in the sort direction field/position of the artifact size column. I'll attach an image.

We're fronting Artifactory with Apache using mod_proxy_http. We use 'AllowEncodedSlashes on' and 'ProxyPass /artifactory <url> nocanon' if that matters.

column1: Misconfiguration of smart remote repository should be detected during configuration
column39:
The use case is configuration of a smart remote repository of type A that points to a local repository of type B from a different artifactory instance.

It is expected that in case of a smart remote repository, we will detect the misconfiguration to alert that to the user.
Except in case of a docker remote repository, the configuration is successful.
For docker remote repository, a 404 error is returned on the uI (on the request.log there is a 400 error which is much more logical).

column1: Enter credentials to the Resolve configuration of the PyPi Set Me Up
column39: At the moment using the Insert Credentials in the PyPi Set Me Up will insert them for the Deploy configuration but not for the Resolve configuration. This may make it slightly harder for users to setup their PyPi resolve configuration.

column1: Request to allow GAVC search on remote repos (without adding '-cache')
column39:
When running a GAVC search a remote repository the user should not need to specify the '-cache' in the repo name.
The fact that GAVC search return results only for local repositories and 'remote-cache' part should not matter for the user. From a user's point of view there should be only a single point of access to the remote repository.

The differentiation between remote and remote-cache should be obscured from the user.
